Thanks to her very hard work and her dedication, she now owns 0.15 hectares of land on which she grows corn, annually, for the farm's domestic consumption and for sale.  She also has two cows and two horses on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS) from her farming activity.  In order to further expand her activity, Buaisha has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to prepare her land for cultivation.  She will also use part of her loan to buy sheep.  Buaisha intends to grow her business, which will directly  increase her family's capital.  She wants to invest the earnings from her loan into her children's higher education.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and also buy some sheep.

loans.name: Khavere's Group

texts.en:
Khavere, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 50 years old, married, and has six children.

Khavere likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. Khavere plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Khavere’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will be receiving solar light, a total of five solar lights will be received among them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the stock in her small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks (juice, soda and water), sugar, soap, and rice to restock her market stall.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 22-year-old, single man from Gaza City. He has a barbershop in the city. It has been open for the past three years. Zaki is always thinking how to improve his business to make it more attractive. 

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair and a steam machine. This will increase the demand for his barbershop, and also his income.  Zaki appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new chair and a steam machine.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A sra Rosa, tem 36 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 02 filhos dos quais um estuda e o outro é menor de idade. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta a sua sobrinha que é órfã de pais.
Ela tem um salão e boutique ao lado da sua casa onde passa a maior parte do tempo a trabalhar.
Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00mts, vai investir na compra de produtos do salão, tais como: restores, dark in love, champoo, massagem e roupa para boutique: chinelos, sapatilhas, saias, vestidos e outros vestuários para revender.
Esta senhora, apesar de enfrentar dificuldades financeiras, sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e aumentar o seu salão e o seu desafio é trabalhar mais para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and single. She has two children, one of whom studies and the other one is underage. Aside from her children she supports her niece who has lost both her parents.
She owns a beauty parlor and a boutique next door to her house and she spends most of her time working there.
With the loan for 30.000mts she will invest in the purchase of supplies for the salon such as hair repair and hair care products, shampoo, and massage oils, as well as clothes for the boutique: slippers, flats, skirts, gowns and other garments for re-selling.
Even though she faces financial struggles, this lady dreams of expanding her business and enlarging her salon. Her challenge is working harder so that she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase hair repair and hair care products, shampoo, massage oils, and clothes for the boutique: slippers, flats, skirts, gowns and other garments for re-selling.

loans.name: Segundo Walter

texts.es:
Segundo Walter tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Segundo Walter se dedica a la venta de gaseosas; cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, este servicio lo ofrece por todo el distrito de Oyotún, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, pues él desea realizar la compra de cantidades mayores de gaseosa, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Segundo Walter piensa tener mayor stock de productos (diferentes marcas de gaseosas y/ o bebidas) para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Walter is 41 years old, is in a civil union, and has two children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún district, in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru. The community basically makes their living from farming, ranching, and retail. Segundo Walter makes his living selling sodas. He has more than three years of experience in the business. He offers this service all over the district of Oyotún.

He is asking for a loan for working capital because he wants to buy large quantities of sodas. This investment will serve him by increasing his sales and having a big impact on his business. Segundo Walter is thinking about having a greater stock of products (different soda brands and/or other drinks) to be able to meet a variety of the needs, requirements, and tastes of his customers in the area. This will allow him to improve his income, increase his profits and improve his and his family's quality of life in the short term.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of sodas. This investment will serve him by increasing his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a 31-year-old motorcycle taxi driver, volunteer teacher, and mother. Julieta runs her own motorcycle transportation service. She is now asking  for a Kiva loan to go towards funding another motorcycle in order to increase her business income. Over the next three years, Julieta is planning to buy a total of four motorcycles, which will generate the profits to ensure her daughter can study at a good school. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Julieta  teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. The interest on Julieta’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 31-year-old store owner, volunteer teacher, and mother of two. Anna is asking for a loan from KIVA in order to improve the building infrastructure of her store. She will use the profits she generates from this to continue covering her family’s basic daily needs and to start sending her children to school. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Anna teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. The interest on her “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: improve her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a 20-year-old volunteer teacher and entrepreneur, supporting her three siblings with their daily expenses. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, she teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Through her lessons, Habiba encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. Habiba currently has no business, so she intends on launching a charcoal retail business on receiving a loan. 

Habiba is kind, hardworking and respects everyone in her community. She intends to use her profits to support herself and her parents with their day-to-day expenses. The interest on Habiba’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: start a charcoal business

loans.name: Shida

texts.en: Shida is a 29-year-old farmer, volunteer teacher, and mother of a nine-year-old daughter. Shida works in agriculture in her village, enabling her to meet the dietary and economic requirements of her family. Shida is now asking for a Kiva loan in order to extend her farmland and to buy imported agricultural products with which to increase yields and income.  As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Shida teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Through her lessons, Shida encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world.  The interest on “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: expand her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in growing carrots and expand her farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
LOAN USE: To buy kitchen equipment to support her restaurant.

Irene is a 22-year-old restaurant-owner, volunteer teacher, and mother of one, living with her parents and siblings in the Kilolo district. Irene runs a restaurant business, and is now asking for a loan from Kiva to buy more kitchen products to develop her business. Irene pays for her siblings’ school fees, as well as helping orphans and street children by contributing money to local “Safety Net” funds. 

Some profits she makes will be used to buy herself new clothes, and to update equipment in her restaurant with newer models. With the rest, Irene will help her siblings by paying their school fees, and she will open a side-business in clothing, to meet the high demands in her community. The interest on Irene’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment to support her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fashionable women’s dresses to establish her own clothing business.

loans.name: Karolina

texts.en:
Karolina is a 34-year-old butcher store owner, volunteer teacher, activist, and mother of three.  Karolina particularly likes working with young people. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she dedicates time to work with the youths in her village, organizing debates and discussion forums where they can exchange ideas and learn from each other. Karolina is also a business women who owns a butcher store, processing beef from a village 50 km from her home. Karolina is the only meat distributor in her village. She uses the profits she makes to support her husband with household expenses, and to pay school fees for their children. 

Karolina Is now requesting a KIVA loan in order to expand her business and to hire an assistant to help in the running of the business. The profits this generates will improve the well-being of her whole family. The interest on Karolina’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: expand her butcher store

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 19 -year-old entrepreneur and volunteer teacher, living with her uncle and cousins. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Hadija teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. Hadija has herself experienced the hardship of living without enough money, as her family depends on cultivating and selling food to get cash. She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to open up a local clothing store. As there is nothing similar nearby, this business will generate income for Hadija. Her determination is to accumulate enough profit to overcome the social challenges she has faced so far, and eventually to expand her business into owning a large store. The interest on Hadija’s “social interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: open a clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Santo Domingo, una comunidad dedicada a la crianza de animales y al comercio que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de arroz, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y sus vecinos brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha, con esto Oscar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ventas y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old. He lives with his spouse and his son in Santo Domingo district, a community whose inhabitants raise animals and run small businesses. It is located in Cutervo province in Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. 

He grows rice and has 15 years experience in this business. His neighbors provide very good personal and work references for him. in addition he raises and sells cows. The loan he is requesting he will use to buy manure and fertilizers for maintaining his coffee crop as well as for hiring laborers for the harvest season. With this Oscar hope to offer a better quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his level of sales and will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for maintaining his coffee crop and to hire laborers for the harvest.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy CD's and movies with which to launch her rental store.

loans.name: Marko's Group

texts.en:
Marko, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 60 years old, married, and has seven children.

Marko likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to save more money. Marko is excited to be receiving a solar light since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. He plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Marko’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.50 acres of land. In addition, the group will receive a total of 14 solar lights between them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
LOAN USE: To buy fruits as capital to launch her market business.

Tausi is a 20-year-old volunteer teacher, living with her mother and other relatives. Though she doesn’t yet have her own business, Tausi volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. She teaches life skills to students in her local secondary school, including lessons on effective communication and personal confidence. Through her lessons, Tausi encourages students to find their own strengths, and to think about how to create a better world. 

Tausi now plans to invest in selling goods at a market. She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to start this business and overcome the initial challenge of acquiring capital. Tausi is determined to own a large fruit stall. Through this, she can supply products to those in need, while also supporting her relatives with their basic daily essentials.

loans.use: to buy fruits as capital to launch her market business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing with which to launch a business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretera Belaunde Terry, lo que le ha permitido a su población dedicarse a la venta de comida preparada a los pasajeros que transitan por la zona, comercio de frutas y cultivo de los mismos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad Jaén, Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y cultivo de lima desde hace varios años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientela considerable en la zona quienes brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de lima y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos para ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorando por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and children in the San Felipe district, a community located on the Belaunde Terry highway, 2 hours away from Jaén on the north coast of Peru. This has allowed the population to find work selling prepared food to travelers passing through the area, growing and selling fruit. Pedro has worked growing and selling limes for several years. He has experience in this business and a considerable clientele in the area, who give good personal and work references of him. He has requested a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to give maintenance to his lime crops. This will improve the quality of his lime crops and he will be able to offer them at a better price, increasing his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers in order to give maintenance to his lime crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women’s clothes and launch a fashion business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes and home products to sell from her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sunflower oil in bulk.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros y de esta manera abastecer su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 45, lives together with her husband and children in the district of Cayalti, a community which makes its living through agriculture, commerce and ranching and is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region of the north coast of Peru.
She makes a living from the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, and noodles amongst other things.  Her business is located in her house.  She has experience in this business and has firm customers who offer good personal and work references for her.  
She has requested a loan in order to buy articles of primary necessity such as rice, sugar, and oil amongst other things and in this way to stock her business in order to offer to her customers and to generate greater income for her family which will permit her to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to buy articles of primary necessity such as rice, sugar, and oil amongst other things and in this way to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her store and buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice's  Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Beatrice, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 36 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Beatrice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Beatrice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Beatrice is excited to be receiving a solar light since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. Beatrice will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of nine acres. In addition, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights between them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 27-year-old single man who started working with his father 14 years ago in the aluminum field. Throughout the years, he gained experience and professional skills which allowed him to manage his father's shop.

Hussein is an ambitious man and hard worker who is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy aluminum pistons which will facilitate his work and allow him to provide his customers with better, faster service.

Hussein hopes to expand his business further in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy aluminum pistons which will facilitate his work.

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Josphat is the group leader of his group in Kakamega North District, and he is representing six farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of two children. Josphat joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for four years.

Like many other farmers, Josphat decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Josphat's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of two acres of land. Given that other members of the group will be purchasing a solar light, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru, aged 23, is a volunteer teacher and mother of one, living with her parents in the Kilolo district. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Nuru volunteers for two and a half hours per week to teach life skills to students. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.

Nuru is requesting a Kiva loan to launch a clothing business in her local community. The profits from this will help her to cover household expenses for her family, and to send her child to school. The interest on Nuru’s loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to launch her own clothing business in the local community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch her own shoe store in her village

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a tailor from her house since 2005, to support her husband in making a living and covering their increasing living expenses.

Iman is a hardworking lady; she is well-known for her special tailoring talents, and her encouraging prices.

Iman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special spring and summer clothing collections, to support her current tailoring business with an additional income sector. She hopes that one day she can develop her business to open a separate shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy special spring and summer clothing collections to support her current tailoring business.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Эту жизнерадостную и красивую девушку зовут Мавзуна. Ей 30 лет. Она жена и мать. Мавзуна с семьей проживает на районе А.Джоми. Она занимается животноводством у себя дома. Она покупает маленьких телят, откармливает в течение определенного времени и после перепродает с наценкой. Таким не хитрым способом она приносит в дом источник дохода. Этот бизнес она продвигает более 4 лет. Мавзуна считает, что за столь время она набралась большого опыта работы и время расширить малый бизнес. Мавзуна намерена на заемные деньги купить несколько голов крупно рогатого скота, увеличить поголовья скота и соответственно увеличится доход от деятельности. Она верит, что ее поддержит и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Meet Mavzuna, a happy and wonderful 30-year-old woman.  Mavzuna is a wife and mother.  She lives with her family in the A. Jomi district and she raises cattle at home.  She buys young calves, fattens them for some time and then resells them for a profit.  Thanks to this simple business she brings home a source of income.  She has been involved in this business for more than four years.  Mavzuna believes that she has acquired a good deal of experience over this period of time and that she should now expand her small business.  She intends to use her loan to buy a few head of cattle and increase her livestock headcount, so that she can increase the income she makes from her activity.  She is confident that she will receive some support, and she thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el ditrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales principalmente, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, etc; cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; con esto Lilia espera mejorar la productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lilia is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotun, in a rural zone where life is tranquil and residents dedicate themselves, principally, to commerce and raising animals. Oyotun is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast.

Lilia raises and sells animals such as ducks, chickens, roosters, hens, turkeys, pigs, etc. She can count on her more than 10 years of experience in the business. The business is located in her own domicile. 

Lilia is requesting a loan to purchase more animals in order to increase her business's stock. The investment will serve to give her more diversity and variety of animals, and will greatly affect the business. With this, Lilia hopes to improve her animal's productivity and to help her attend to diverse needs as well as the tastes of customers in her zone. This will result in a higher level of income, improving the quality of life of Lilia and her family.

loans.use: to purchase more farm animals in order to increase her business's livestock.

loans.name: Laure

texts.en: Laure is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. She opened a beauty salon seven years ago in her town. She has her loyal customers, and they are glad with the results they get, and she is so happy with what she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase goods for her work such as a mirror and chair for her business and new chairs. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good-quality products.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her work such as a mirror and chair for her business and new chairs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old farmer at Bamba Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children whose husband provides additional income and has been in this business for the last three years with a great income.

This marks her fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after servicing her previous loans successfully. She will use the requested loan to purchase stock of cashew nuts for resale and also animal and poultry feeds. She will use the anticipated profit to pay for her children's education. She hopes to have a successful family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cashew nuts for resale and also animal and poultry feeds

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Elizabeth is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Elizabeth started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. Elizabeth is also excited to be receiving a solar light because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Elizabeth’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10 acres of land. In addition, the group will be receiving a total of six solar lights between them.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy assorted bags to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cypriano's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Cypriano, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. He is 38 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and has two children.

Cypriano is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Cypriano says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2014, he has been able to save more money, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Cypriano is also receiving a solar light which he is so excited about because he will now have an overall improved quality of life. He will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.50 acres. In addition, the group will also be receiving a total of 4 solar lights between them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to operate her canvas shoe business and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Saul's Group

texts.en:
Saul, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 62 years old and a married father of eight children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Saul has been a farmer for more than 30 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though he is new to the program, Saul wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Saul hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will be purchasing solar light, the group will also be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights among them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Edward is the group leader of his group in Kakamega North District, and he is representing  11 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of two children. Edward joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for more than 30 years.

Like many other farmers, Edward decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He is so excited to receive a solar light which he says that now he will be able to have somewhere to charge his phone. Edward plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to repair his home.

Edward's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5 acres of land. In addition, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights between them.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Hello world, meet Joseph, a farmer from a small village in the Nandihills area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. He lives on the farmland with his wife of 20 years and six children. He started farming in order to provide food for his family and make additional income from the farm activities. Today, his primary income sources from the farm are milk, maize and a variety of food crops. Joseph has favoured animal keeping since they provide a regular source of income at a low maintenance cost. He is seeking a small business loan to purchase a beef cow. The cow will provide beef for sale. Income from the beef cow investment will help him settle other business-related expenses such as farm inputs for crop cultivation. Joseph stated, "With the money, I will be able to buy another cow and boost my family's income. I will use the income to pay tuition fees for my children without a strain." Help him out!

loans.use: To buy a beef cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is 37 years old and from Minia. She is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer (part time). Three years ago, she started a poultry-feed project in her house to help her husband with the family income. She dreams of expanding her project by selling cattle-fattening feed. So, she requested a 2,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy cattle-fattening feed to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle-fattening feed to expand her project and increase her income for her family.

loans.name: Jayamma

texts.en:
Jayamma lives in Hirekerur, Haveri, Karnataka with her family. 

Jayamma started agriculture in 2006, after quitting her nursing job. She trained women in her village on organic farming. Later from 2010 she started preparing value added products like ragi malt and chili powder.  Later she procured a machine for preparing multi-grain atta. 

She is able to sustain her family on her own and she is a role model to other women in her surroundings. She also encourages other women to be independent. She is requesting a loan as she wants to add a chilli powder making machine.

loans.use: to buy a chilli powder making machine

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est âgée 38 ans et vit à Tokoin. Afi  est mariée mère de quatre enfants à sa charge. Afi vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour subvenir aux charges et s’épanouir. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi veut passer une commande de sacs de maïs et demande ce crédit pour le réaliser afin de disposer d’une rentabilité nécessaire pour leur épanouissement
texts.en: Afi is 38 years old and lives in Tokoin. She is a married mother of four children in her care. Afi sells charcoal in her neighborhood to obtain the profits necessary for covering expenses and succeeding in life. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. She wants to put in an order for sacks of corn and is asking for this loan to make it happen, so as to have the profitability needed for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mengnihol

texts.ru: Менгнихол успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Она очень благодарно за Вашу поддержку. Благодаря Вам, сейчас ее сын  учится втором курсе. Менгнихол продвигает свой бизнес. У нее хорошо получается, и унее появились больше клиентов. Сейчас Менгнихол еще раз просит кредит за обучение сына. На оставшуюся 20% часть денег она тратит на расходы университета. Без Вашей помощью они будут исключать ее сына с университета. Она верит в Вас, что Вы ей поможете, и не откажитесь ей за помощь. Менгнихол заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Mengnihol successfully repaid her previous loan and she is very thankful for your support.  Thanks to you, her son is now a second-year student.  Mengnihol is still growing her business.  Her business is doing well and Mengnihol has been able to attract more customers.  She is now taking another  loan to pay for her son's university tuition.  Twenty percent of the loan's money will also be used to pay some university-related expenses.  Without your help, her son will be expelled from the university.  Mengnihol relies on you and is confident that she'll receive your support.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees, so that he can continue his studies.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 35-year-old Lebanese widow woman living with her three children who are still attending school. 

She became the main income provider in her family since she lost her husband. She has been working at her house in vending clothing to help her family to meet the needs of life. 

She is a talented and working in this type of business since 2011. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. To better develop her work, Rima is requesting a second youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a new collection in order to improve her business and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy new collection for her clothing shop

loans.name: Eudulia

texts.es:
Eudulia tiene 37 años de edad, es separada, tiene 01 hijo, vive en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos en general como correas, tintes, relojes, cds, etc, en el interior del mercado de este distrito, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 06 años, cuenta con muy buenas referencia personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de artículos para incrementar el stock de su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, esto le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eudulia is 37 years old, is separated, and has one son. She lives in the district of Pucará, a community where life is peaceful and the inhabitants make a living in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén, in the region Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Peru.

She makes a living selling general products such as belts, dyes, watches, CDs, etc., in the market in the district. She has been doing this activity for more than 6 years. She has very good personal and work references in her district. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of items to increase the stock of her business and in this way offer a greater variety of products to her customers satisfying their likes and preferences. This will allow her to improve her level of income and therefore have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of items to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en:
Yosra is a 40-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband, and four children, two of whom are working. Due to bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband to help her family to meet the needs of life. 

Yosra is a hard working person; she opened a clothing shop in her town four years ago, where she offers a great variety of clothes at good prices. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Amado Javier

texts.es:
Amado tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, en este lugar la población se dedica a la agricultura, a criar y vender animales de corral y a la ganadería principalmente.

Amado se dedica al comercio y crianza de animales de corral como gallinas, pollos, patos, pavos, entre otros, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales pequeños para su negocio y en arreglos del corral donde cría a sus animales ya que luego de unos meses los podrá vender a un mejor precio y así obtendrá mayores ingresos con la venta de estos, lo que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amado is 39 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has three children in his charge. He lives in his own house in Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. Here, the population is dedicated to agriculture and raising and selling, principally, corral animals and, cattle.

Amado, too, raises and sells  corral animals such as hens, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others stock. He has various years of experience in the business. 

Amado is requesting a loan to invest in buying a larger quantity of small animals for his business and in improving the corral where he raises his animals. Then, after some months, he will be able to sell them for a better price and, thus, obtain greater income from the sale. This will improve the quality of life of both Amado and his family.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a larger quantity of small animals for his business and in improving corral construction for raising his livestock.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 64 years old, is married and has eight children.

Richard likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from farming trainings. Richard is excited to be receiving a solar light, which he is so excited about because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. Richard plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Richard’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.75 acres of land. In addition, the group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights between them.

loans.use: to purchase solar lights, hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta,  au premier rang au centre sur la photo et portant un foulard rouge, est membre d'un groupe de 11 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Kondo, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Fanta, qui est âgée de 36 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 7 personnes. L’agriculture lui permet de préserver la santé et d'assurer la sécurité alimentaire. Elle a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour accès aux intrants et pour la bienfaisance du nouveau système de paiement. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Fanta a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Fanta espère avoir plus de rendements   afin de pouvoir  faire face à la scolarité des enfants, et l’achat des intrants.
texts.en:
Fanta, in the middle of the first row in the photo and wearing a red scarf, is a member of a group of eleven agricultural producers who work and live in the village of Kondo, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 36 years old and lives in a family of seven persons. Farming enables her to keep healthy and ensure her food security. 

Fanta decided to sign up with myAgro to access farm inputs and to benefit from a new system of payment. For her first year with myAgro, she purchased a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts in her field of 0.0625 hectare. Through this purchase, she hopes to have more yield in order to be able to cope with her children’s schooling costs and to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase  a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Good Samaritan School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Bettie. She is the Head teacher of Good Samaritan School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Wakiso with 2,000 students. Good Samaritan School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water-filtration systems will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water-treatment systems with a 450 litre tank and a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Good Samaritan School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Bettie ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 35 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto su esposo e hijos, su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, entre otros, así como a la siembra y venta de panca y alfalfa y a la crianza y venta de animales como patos y pollos. Cuenta con experiencia en la labor que realiza y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su tienda, con esto Luzmila espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. Her family is close. They live in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

She works selling basic food items like rice, sugar, milk and oil amongst others. As well she grows and sells panca (corn fodder) and alfalfa and raises and sells small animals like ducks and chickens. She has experience in these fields and has regular clients who can provide very good references for her. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of products to increase the stock of her store. Doing this Luzmila hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients which will generate higher income which will allow her to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to increase her store's stock.

loans.name: Muhogo One Group

texts.en:
Salumu, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children; two of them are grown-up and one is still at school.  He has been selling secondhand clothes since 1995.  He works from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salumu's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to continue increasing the secondhand clothes stock and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, a radio, sofa set, fridge, cupboard and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy first-class secondhand clothes to meet his customers' requirements and demands.  He dreams of buying a big stock of secondhand clothes.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group, Muhogo One, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy first-class secondhand clothes to meet his customers' requirements and demands.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposo y un nieto, su cónyugue es peón agrícola. Viven en el Caserío Huancas, distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. El caserío donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

La actividad que realiza Angelica es criar y vender animales desde hace 5 años, su negocio funciona en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de un número mayor de cerdos y mejoramiento de los corrales donde estos son criados. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida del animal para poder venderlo a un mejor precio lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica is 53 years old. She lives in her own house made of rustic materials along with her husband and a grandson. Her husband is an agricultural laborer. They live in the hamlet of Huancas, in the district of Querocotillo and the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The hamlet where she lives is a little rural zone where the residents know each other and work principally in agriculture and livestock raising.

For five years, Angelica's business has been raising and selling animals. Her business is located behind her residence. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a greater number of pigs and improvements in the pens where they are raised. This investment will allow her to improve the quality of life of the animals so that she can sell them at a better price, which will allow her in the short term to improve her income, increase her earnings, and in the end improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a greater number of pigs and improvements in the pens where they are raised.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-moving food which clients want to eat, like rice, beans, meat, flours, cooking oil, spices for making pilalow and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Thoma

texts.en:
Thoma is a 53-year-old villager and a married father of one, who needs your financial help to buy cherry seedlings and dig the soil to plant them. He has been doing agriculture for the past almost 10 years; he plants and harvests mostly onions, leeks and wheat and sells such products in large quantities to whole buyers. 

In the background of the photograph you can see some warm beds covered in plastic where villagers plant the seeds; when these seeds become seedlings and can handle the cold weather, they then plant them outside. Not all seeds can be planted this way; for example crops. "I thought of planting 100 cherry seedlings, so that I produce large quantities of those. Mostly, these fruits are imported, thus I can sell them at a lower price compared to what they have been sold until now," said Thoma to the loan officer, while taking him to the field. 

Thoma lives in the district of Korca that is best known not only for the delicious cuisine but also for the largest production of apples, quince, beans and other legumes, grains, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy cherry seedlings and dig the soil to plant them

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 45-year-old woman with a family of five, four of whom are already done with their studies. Florence is involved in agriculture, such as coffee growing and cattle keeping. Florence believes the future is bright with this opportunity from UGAFODE to enable her loan request, and according to her, she is described as an honest and hardworking woman who has educated her children up to a university level.

She has three acres of coffee plantation, and through this a lot has been achieved, such as paying of tuition fees for all her children who have graduated through university level and her studies as well. Florence has acquired this loan in order to add fertilizers in her coffee plantation and to buy coffee plants for planting in the rainy season. Her biggest problem affecting coffee production is vagaries of weather, especially the dry season that dries coffee plants, plus price fluctuation of coffee.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, et qui tiens la pochette n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dalakana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Fatoumata, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 10 enfants âgés de 19 à 33 ans, dont 10 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance de sa famille, ont incité Fatoumata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 34 ans. Fatoumata cultive l'arachide et l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de bœufs. Fatoumata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des engrais de qualité et du système de paiement . Cette année Fatoumata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Fatoumata cultive l'arachide. Fatoumata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs. Enfin Fatoumata espère aussi pouvoir acheter des habits pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, in the second row at the left in the photo and holding a pochette n'gasene, is a member of a group of sixteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Dalakana, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 56 years old and the mother of ten children, aged 10 to 33, all currently provided with education. 

Fatoumata is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food security at home. Farming also enables her to ensure her family is self-sufficient. Thus, she has been driven to do this work for 34 years now. She grows peanuts and beans on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of quality fertilizer and cattle.  

Fatoumata started her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the quality fertilizer and the payment system. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.0625 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for thirty years. 

With an increase in yields and her income, Fatoumata is planning on purchasing cattle. Finally, she also hopes to be able to purchase some clothing for her children.

loans.use: to purchase OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Fiqiri

texts.en:
This is Fiqiri, a villager and a father of two being photographed at the vehicle that he uses for the transportation of construction materials from the wholesalers to households and businesses. The reason that he is requesting your financial help is to pay for the vehicle documents that recently expired. Due to this, he hasn’t been able to run the vehicle.
 
“I have been stressed out since the documents of my vehicle expired; I kept running it without them because I had no money and was caught twice and paid the price big time,” said Fiqiri. He makes about $150/month from doing transportation and no other people in his family work. They have some fruit orchards such as figs, plums, peaches, persimmons and grapevines and also 15 chickens and plant seasonal veggies. Yet, all these they use for the family and sell nothing.

loans.use: to pay for the expired documents of the vehicle that he uses to transport construction materials from wholesalers to households and businesses; this is his activity

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en:
Lumanai is 48 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural village on the island of Upolu in Samoa. 

Lumanai has a small cattle farm and sells produce from her plantation. She has been running her plantation and cattle farm for six years now. 

Lumanai is applying for a loan to help her pay for her son’s tertiary (post-secondary) education tuition fee. Lumanai has had 11 loans with SPBD and has an excellent repayment record.

She hopes to help her son complete his tertiary education and see him graduate.

loans.use: A loan of WST 680 helps Lumanai to pay for her son's tertiary (post-secondary) education tuition fee.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en: Rocio  is 48 years old. She is an employee at a lawyer's office. Rocio is divorced and she is taking care of her little daughter. Rocio needs a loan to pay her daughter's school tuition. Rocio has many expenses; she has to pay rent, for instance, and her ex-husband doesn't support her at all. Rocio would like to have her own house in the future. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school tuition

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en:
Soeum, 41, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun, 47, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of five children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат 29 летняя жительница небольшого района под названием Шахринав. Она гордо носит статус жены и мамы. Малохат дома занимается домашними делами, следит за детьми и параллельно берет заказы на шитье одежды. Малохат в сфере швейной деятельности уже 10 лет. 
   Сейчас на ее пути стоит проблема, по которой она не может продолжить свою деятельность. Швейная машинка Малохат сломана и не подлежит дальнейшему использованию. На данный момент она шьет только вручную. Малохат обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет сохранить источник дохода и помочь мужу обеспечить семью.
texts.en: Malohat is a 29-year-old resident of a small district called Shahrinav.  She is proud to be a wife and mother.  Malohat takes care of the household, raises her children and also receives orders at home to sew clothes.  She has been working in this sphere of activity for ten years already.  She is currently facing a problem, which is preventing her from pursuing her activity.  Her sewing machine is broken and can no longer be used. Right now, Malohat can only sew by hand.  She is taking a loan because she wants to keep her source of income and to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine of the "Yamata" brand.

loans.name: Khoeurt

texts.en:
Khoeurt, 43, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of one child. She is a construction worker and earns, on average, USD 10.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun, 46, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of six children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 67 años de edad, ella es viuda, vive con su hija en casa propia en el Sector Arequipa del distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y comercio como actividades económucas principales.

Olinda se dedica a las actividad de crianza y venta de animales, tales como cuyes, conejos, pollos, patos, entre otros, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno, dicha inversión le servirá para poder diversificar su stock de animales y así poder atender a todos los gustos de su público consumidor y por ende aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olinda is 67 years old. She is a widow, and she lives with her daughter in her own house in the Arequipa Sector in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. Life is very tranquil and harmonious here. The population works in agriculture and commerce as their main economic activities. Olinda works raising and selling animals, such as guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, and ducks, among others. She has over 5 years of experience in this business, which is run in the back of her house. She is asking for a loan to buy cattle, which will allow her to diversify her animal inventory, and be able to supply the needs of her customers and consequently, increase sales, earnings, and improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to diversify her animal inventory.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Melecia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy fish net and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Melecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other fishing supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is an old man--30 years old--living with his children and a wife. He is involved in cattle rearing/fattening from his home area.  According to him, he has been in this activity for over 35 years and alongside that, James is involved in cattle trading, which also majorly contributes to his sources of income. According to him through the above projects, James has been able to buy land plus also take care of his family and sisters. James has also acquired this loan to boost his cattle-fattening business and retail shop business.

James says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders. According to him, his biggest challenges are lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather. He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. Finally, he appeals to UGAFODE to loan him much more money to boost his businesses.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Sreyneat

texts.en: Sreyneat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her family. She has four brothers and sisters and is the fourth child in her family. Her family owns five hectares of rice fields and five hectares of cassava fields. In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyneat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 20 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her family. She has four brothers and sisters who all work in the family fields. They own 10 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field. In 2012, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women, by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Sreyneang makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the fields. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Marady

texts.en: Marady is 28 years old and a single employee worker who resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has been working as an employee since 2014, earning around $5 per day. His parents are rice farmers. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in tourism at the university in the province. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees for the third year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, he dreams of saving money to run his own business and to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the third year

loans.name: Metaaknuch

texts.en: Metaaknuch is a 20-year-old single freshman who is from the Kandal province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law at a university in the city. Her father is a journalist and her mother is a homemaker. Due to the fact that Metaaknuch is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her dreams, she hopes to find a proper job with a decent salary, and she also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en:
Nasy, 50, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom, 42, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of four children. She is a Khmer noodle seller. On average, she is able to earn USD 10.00 a day .So far, she has been in this career for eight years.She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra, 49, is married and has four children. Her husband is a blacksmith. Four years ago she opened a grocery store to help support the family and its increasing daily and educational expenses.

Zahra’s income covers her family’s expenses but is not enough to help her develop her business at the same time. For this reason she is applying for a 1,200 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer cold beverages and other specialty products.

This is Zahra’s second loan from Al Majmoua, and she is a borrower in good standing. Her previous loan was used to increase her business capital.

loans.use: increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer cold beverages and other specialty products.

loans.name: Saroeung

texts.en:
Saroeung, 56, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of eight children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years. On average, she is able to earn an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, 50, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Chriep

texts.en:
Chriep, 50, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, 40, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.50 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: build a latrine

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, de la región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales

El se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su unidad vehicular (combi), cuenta con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.
