El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su unidad vehicular (combi) ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Amado espera brindar un mejor servicio de transporte para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes de la zona y darles una mayor seguridad, esto se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Amado is 48 years old. He is  married, and has 3 children. He lives with his family in a rural zone of Oyotún district, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population in this zone works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry as their main economic activities. He works offering transportation services in his vehicle (a combi van). He has more than 1 year of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be to make repairs and maintain his vehicle (van) since it currently is in poor condition. With this, Amado hopes to offer a better transportation service to be able to satisfy the needs of his customers in the zone and provide them better safety. This will also be reflected in his level of income which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To make repairs and maintenance to his vehicle (combi van) which is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 43 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

Annabel has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 30-year-old man with a wife and four children, all living with him. Christopher is basically a businessman and solely trades agricultural produce such as maize and coffee, plus he has a milling machine which he runs in his trading center. According to him, he is a hardworking man who has been able to achieve a lot from the produce business. More than that, Christopher is involved in agriculture, and through this he has been able to construct a permanent home and educate his children. According to him his main challenge is price fluctuation which has led to loss of capital. Christopher appeals to UGAFODE management to reduce the interest rate.

loans.use: To buy corn and coffee to sell

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emely is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Emely has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from duck raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 37 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, candies, canned goods, etc.

Liberty has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, candies, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Analyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like net, bamboo, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like net, bamboo, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 34 years old, married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима благодарит Вас за поддержку и помощь. За счет кредита она приобрела ткани и нитки. Она заметно набралась больше опыта в данной деятельности. Ее работы стали еще больше интереснее и живее. Она та, которая поддерживает древнюю культуру Таджикистана. Фотима обратилась за повторным кредитом, чтобы продолжить деятельность и купить швейные принадлежности. Она верит и надеется, что ее поддержат снова и заранее выражает благодарность.
texts.en: Fotima thanks you for your help and support.  She used her (previous) loan to buy fabrics and threads.  She has gained some noticeable experience in her craft and her work has become even more interesting and lively.  She is one of those people who keep the ancient traditions of Tajikistan alive.  Fotima is taking a second loan to continue her activity and to buy sewing supplies.  She is confident that she will receive some support again and she thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Inci

texts.en:
Inci is 24, married and has two daughters that she loves very much. For the past five years she and her husband have been farmers. Their crops bring them approximately 300 AZN monthly.

Inci and her husband bought additional land in order to increase their harvest and income. Now she has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to pay the monthly rental charge for a tractor. They plan to buy a tractor in the future, as it will be better and easier for them to own one.

loans.use: to pay the monthly rental charge for a tractor.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз жительница района Вахш. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей.  Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он зарабатывает и отправляет деньги домой. У Сарвиноз есть маленький бизнес. Она продает детские одежды и разные продукты. Сарвиноз хочет, привозит больше ассортимент товаров, и расширить деятельность. Но у нее нет такое количество денег, чтобы расширить бизнес. По этой причине Сарвиноз обратилась за кредитом. Сарвиноз верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sarvinoz is a resident of the Vakhsh district.  She is 36 years old and the married mother of three children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  He makes money there and sends home his income.  Sarvinoz has a small business.  She sells children's clothes and other various goods.  She now wants to bring in a larger selection of goods and expand her activity.  However, she doesn't have the money necessary to increase her business.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  She relies on you and trusts that you will support her.

loans.use: to bring in children's clothes and food products.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Puerto Perez’ que es un pequeño pueblo ubicado a unos 50 km de la ciudad a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca, la población tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, la pesca y la ganadería, desde este lugar se embarca a las diferentes islas del lago, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados y a una altura aproximada de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Fabiana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física mediana, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca; ella se ocupa de comprar lana directamente de los productores en grandes cantidades para hilvanarla y tejerla. Los tejidos que realiza son del tipo manta. La manta es una especie de frazada que las mujeres de vestir tradicional utilizan sobre los hombros para cubrirse del frío. Todo el proceso de tejido e hilvanado lo realiza en su domicilio y de forma manual. “tejo mantas desde que era niña, todo comenzó cuando ayudaba con los quehaceres de la casa y tejer era parte de la vida cotidiana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos y vende por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de lana por mayor. Su sueño es contar con una tienda especializada en tejido de alpaca, ella desea realizar la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para cumplir con sus pedidos y abrir una tienda. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Fabiana solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para cumplir con sus pedidos y abrir una tienda de tejidos.
texts.en: Fabiana is a 29 year old woman, married with 3 children ages 7, 5, and 2 years old. Her business is to knit alpaca shawls (mantas.)  She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, optimistic, responsible, and hard working. She works in the "Puerto Perez" location, which is a small village located approximately 50 kilometers. from the city, on the edges of the sacred lake Titicaca. The population works primarily in agriculture, fishing, and livestock. From this location, people get around the different islands on the lake. Its climate is cold and dry, with a temperature which fluctuates between 0-12 degrees Celsius, and an approximate altitude of 4000 meters above sea level. Fabiana is dark complected, brown eyes, long, black braided hair, medium built, short stature. She dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and skirt) and her native tongue is Aymara which is spoken in the area. She speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for her business. She spends her life with her husband who works in construction and with their children. The two oldest boys go to school, and the youngest is not of school age yet. They live in their own house built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof, well water, and electricity. Her business is knitting alpaca shawls. She buys wool directly from the producers in greater quantities to spool ad knit it. The knits she makes are styled as large shawls or blankets. The manta is a type of blanket used by women traditionally, worn over their shoulders to protect themselves from the cold. The spool ad knitting process is done manually at home. "I knit shawls since I was a little girl, it started when I used to help with the chores in the household, and knitting was part of our daily life..."she stated. The advantage of her business is that she has consistent clients and she sells wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase wool wholesale. Her dream is to have a specialized textile store. She wants to buy alpaca wool wholesale to fulfill her orders and open a store. This is the third sequence of loans with the institution in the 6 years she has worked in this field independently. This is why Fabiana is asking for a loan to buy alpaca wool wholesale, to fulfill her orders and open a textile store.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool wholesale to fulfill her orders and to open a textile store.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María Alicia tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún una comunidad acogedora donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias, esto le permitirá obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia is 52 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Oyotún district, a welcoming community where its population works in agriculture, trade and raising cattle. It is located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She has a grocery store where she provides a variety of staple goods like milk, sugar, rice and oil. Her husband helps her with this work. She has experience in this business and good references in her district.

She has requested a loan to buy a variety of products to offer her customers, satisfying their tastes and preferences. This will allow her to obtain a higher level of income and will consequently improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 23 years old and has two children. 

Juvy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juvy has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juvy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Rechille is 17 years old and is the only child in the family. Her mother Teresita supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Rechille is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Teresita is borrowing 7,300 PHP to pay for the tuition fees for the first semester of the year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Rechille plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has been blessed with four children, three of whom attend school while the fourth is yet too young to go. The family owns their own house, but it has neither electricity nor piped water. The family’s main monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over a year Asha has sold fish to make a living. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge to her business.

Asha joined Yehu in order to access loans to develop her business. She is applying for a 25,000 KES loan to buy more sacks of fish for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 63 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, coffee, eggs, sugar, chips, etc.

Julie has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like noodles, coffee, eggs, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Ariel  De Jesus

texts.es: Las ganas de salir adelante son las que caracterizan a Ariel de Jesús, el don que tiene para tocar la guitarra lo lleva en la sangre es por esta razón que decidió formar su propio grupo de mariachi y de esta manera ganarse la vida honradamente. Para seguir dándose a conocer Don Ariel solicita un crédito para dar publicidad al grupo y que todas las personas de su comunidad y sus departamento logren conocerlo. Entre sus planes futuros esta grabar un disco y que todas las personas puedan disfrutar de su música.
texts.en: The desire to get ahead is what characterizes Ariel de Jesus. He carries the gift to play the guitar in his blood. For this reason, he started his own mariachi group to make an honest living. To make himself known better, Mr. Ariel is asking for a loan to advertise his group and to be known by the people in his community and the region. Among his future plans are to make a record and to have everybody enjoy his music.

loans.use: To advertise their group.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Iis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Iis. She lives in North Bogor, located in West Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. 

Iis owns a stall where she sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to expand her business to another sector, technology. 

As her business grows, Iis needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. 

Iis’s goal in the near future with Ruma is to provide an e-commerce business to her community and Ruma’s latest product, Mapan. As seen in the photo above, Iis is in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her community.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is an old man, aged fifty-three years. He lives with his children and wife in a rural area. 

He is involved in cattle rearing and fattening from his home area, because it is the predominant activity in the area. According to him, he has been involved with this activity for over twenty-five years. Wilson is also involved in cattle trading, which contributes greatly to his income. According to him, through the above projects Wilson has been able to buy land and also take care of his family and sisters.

Wilson is acquiring this loan to boost his cattle fattening business. Wilson says his customers are basically people from his home area, as well as traders. According to him, his biggest challenge is limited capital to boost his businesses, as well as bad weather.

He is described as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten and sell

loans.name: Haydee Evelyn

texts.es: Haydee vive sola en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la venta de pollos y pescado, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual le genera buenas ganancias para lograr salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos por mayor y así poder seguir con sus ventas para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Haydee lives by herself in her own house. She works selling chickens and fish. Her business is in her house. She has  over 10 years working in this activity which has generated her good earnings to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens wholesale, and to continue with her sales to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chickens wholesale

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is 59 years old. He is married with a son and two daughters. He is a gardener and has worked in this area for a long time. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of the family. 

Shahin has land and raises crops. Then he supplies food to local restaurants and bakery houses and earns 200 AZN monthly. All of his customers are pleased to purchase goods from Shahin because his harvest is always fresh and tasty.

Shahin wants to expand his garden and increase his income. He installed an irrigation system many years ago and now he needs to repair it. He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to call a professional to repair his irrigation system.

loans.use: to call a professional to repair his irrigation system

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 57-year-old widowed mother of two children, whom she works hard to support, with no one else to help. She has worked as a tailor since 1987. She is very talented in her domain and has her customers' trust and support.

She is looking forward to adding new products to her business. She wants to increase her bed shields and towels capital, in order to increase her income. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to support her bed shields and towels selling business through diversifying her products with newly released spring and summer collections.

This will be her fourteenth loan cycle, with a good record of paying back her loans. Her previous loans helped her a lot in expanding and developing her business. She hopes to keep satisfying her customers' needs and developing her business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To support her bed shield and towel selling business through diversifying her products with newly released spring and summer collections

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la confección de ropa especialmente vestidos para bodas, quince años, graduaciones, etc. tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas de diferentes estilos, elásticos, botones, encajes, lentejuelas y otros materiales necesarios para seguir con la confección de la ropa y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Domitila is 47 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. For the past ten years, she has been in the business of making clothing, especially wedding dresses and dresses for quinceañeras and graduation celebrations. She has many clients because of the quality of her work, and she is able to get ahead thanks to the sales she makes. Domitila requests a loan to purchase various styles of fabric, as well as elastics, buttons, lace, glitter and the other materials she needs to continue producing clothing. This will help her increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics, elastics, buttons, lace, sequins and other materials.

loans.name: Silvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Silvia, vive con sus familiares y es madre de un hijo, ella no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero, el único ingreso que posee para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia son los que genera al vender semilla de marañón y sardinas, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió con la ayuda de su familia, ya tiene mucha experiencia en realizar dicha actividad, su mayor dificultad es la escases del producto para poder comercializarlo, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Comprará semilla de marañón y sardinas al mayoreo para aprovechar el buen precio de la materia  prima y la temporada de la cosecha, esto le dará la oportunidad de contar con producto suficiente para abastecer a sus clientes y seguir aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y ofrecer un estilo de vida digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her family members and is the mother of one son. She does not receive remittances from abroad, and the only income with which she supports the needs of her family is that which she generates through the sale of cashew seeds and sardines. She has had this business for the past 4 years, and she learned this trade with the help of her family because they have a lot of experience in this area. She works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. Her greatest difficulty is the scarcity of the products which she sells.
She will purchase cashew seeds and sardines in bulk in order to take advantage of the good prices of these raw materials during harvest season. This will afford her the opportunity to get enough product to supply her clients and to continue covering her household expenses. Silvia's dreams are to have her own home and to provide her family with a dignified life style.

loans.use: to purchase cashew seeds and sardines in bulk.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of three children, one of whom attends school and the other two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over three years, she has operated a business selling soft drinks, juice and ice from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of juice and ice for resale and to buy some spare parts for her refrigerator in case of there are breakages . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase juice and ice for resale and to buy some spare parts for her refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy brooms, palm oil and groundnut paste to be resold in the village

loans.name: Jhoshqun

texts.en:
Jhoshqun is 36 and married. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in a small house. Jhoshqun loves his wife very much and does everything in order to provide a good life for her.

Jhoshqun is a gardener. He raises fruits and sells them to neighbours or some local cafes. He has done this for five years and his monthly income is 170 AZN. 

Jhoshqun loves gardening very much and now he applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to repair the water system in the garden and raise his harvest properly. He hopes that this will help him increase his productivity and income.

loans.use: to repair the water system in the garden

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 62 years old and a married father of six children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Joseph has been a farmer for more than 30 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Joseph wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Joseph hopes to be able to send his children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 10 acres of land. Given that some of the members will be purchasing solar lights, the group will receive a total of five solar lights among them.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables. 

She has operated a farming business for the past five years, selling farm products to the neighbours and people at the market. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan, Mary plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.  She decided to join Yehu to get a loan and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business

loans.name: Afsana

texts.en:
Afsana is 30 years old. She is a farmer and she is married. Her husband is a master and repairs broken furniture. Afsana raises and sells fruit. She dries them and sells them at the local bazaar. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. There are a lot of people who sell fruit and dried fruit because people have a high demand for them. 

Afsana applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new trees and raise more fruit. She wants to supply her harvest to other bazaars too and earn more money because her income doesn't cover her living costs.

loans.use: to buy new trees and raise more fruit

loans.name: Winarsih

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Winarsih. Winarsih lives in Depok, located in south of Jakarta, around one hour from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. Winarsih owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to learn about how to become an entrepreneur. 

As the business grows, Winarsih needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Winarsih’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Winarsih is the one who is standing in her stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
Thomas, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is now proud to represent his group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 54 years old, married and has 10 children.

Thomas likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Thomas plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Thomas’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate four acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 41-year-old married father of five children and a man with special needs. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working at selling vegetables and fruits for eight years to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Rabih is working hard and trying desperately to develop his business. Thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with more vegetables and fruits to satisfy his customers' special requests.

Rabih hopes to expand his business further in the future to increase his income and improve his family's social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with more vegetables and fruits to satisfy his customers' special requests

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en:
Mark, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 39 years old, married and has five children.

Mark likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from farming trainings. Mark plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Mark’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Beben

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Beben. Beben lives in Depok, south of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia, about a 1-2 hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Beben owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community.  Beben learned about Ruma from the Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about expanding his business into another sector.

As the business grows, Beben needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Beben’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.  As seen in the photo, Beben is the one who is standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Naikarra Extension Group

texts.en:
Nuria is a middle aged woman living in Naikarra. She is married with six children all of whom study at a neighbouring school. She operates a general shop and is also a mobile money transfer agent. She also sells groceries outside her shop.

Nuria uses a solar lantern for her shop. She closes her shop early after dark because the lantern is not reliable and the light from it is quite dim. Her home is behind the shop. Her children also use a kerosene lamp for reading at night, which limits the hours they can study. She says this affects the childrens' health as sometimes they have colds and chest problems.

Nuria wants to connect to the solar micro-grid in Naikarra.  With the power she anticipates having more sales as she will be able to run her business for a longer period at night. In anticipation for the power she already completed internal wiring inside her home to enable lighting and provide AC sockets, and now her children will have clean energy and no longer complain of chest problems and colds. She is happy about the power and is planning to buy a TV and Fridge soon.

In addition to Nuria, Stephen and Joshua will also be connected to the micro-grid and they look forward to increased economic activity through the reliable and efficient electricity they will now have access to.

loans.use: to connect to the solar micro-grid in Naikarra, which will enable Nuria to keep her shop open later and provide clean lighting for her children.

loans.name: Talisman Group

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por la procedencia de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes del todos lados se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Mary es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste vestido negro). Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de pollo, venta de accesorios de teléfono, venta de horneados, confección de sábanas, venta de embutidos, transporte libre y venta de leche, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otra tienda en el mismo rubro en otro mercado. “necesito capital para invertir en mi negocio y con los beneficios, abriré otro puesto de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener sus tiendas propias en 2 mercados, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Mary solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor abrir una tienda nueva.
texts.en:
Mary 43 years old and lives with her partner and two children, ages 18 and 12 years old. She has business selling second-hand clothes.

Mary is a good mother; she is enterprising, patient, tenacious, responsible and hard-working. She has a business in the 'Plan 3000' area of Santa Cruz, a place known for the roots of the locals, who, in the south of the city, are Aymara, Quechua and Guaraní.  There are also many migrants who came to the city from all over the place and they built up trades that are in constant growth. With a warm, tropical climate, here the daytime temperature oscillates between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Mary is of dark complexion, and has brown eyes and long black hair that she ties back. She is short, thin and her mother tongue is Guaraní, though she also speaks Spanish with her family, for daily life and at her business. In the photo, Mary is seated first on the right, wearing a black dress. Mary spends her life with her partner, a builder, and their children, who are in school. The family lives in a privately-owned room, built of brick and cement that has running water, electricity and is connected to the sewer system. 

With a need to expand her business, Mary decided to start a communal bank of members with businesses, including: selling chicken, selling phone accessories, selling baked goods, producing bedsheets, selling cold meats, providing transportation services and selling milk. The group has come together to apply for a loan and improve their businesses. 

Mary’s has a business selling second-hand clothes, such as trousers, sweatshirts, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, and more. Mary needs to stock-up her business with a greater variety and quantity of clothing in order to compete in the market. She also wants to open another store for second-hand clothes in another market. 

"I need capital to invest in my business and I will use the profits to open another stall,"  Mary says. 

The advantage of Mary’s business is that she can always sell clothing; the disadvantage is that she does not have enough capital to invest in and expand her business. 

Mary’s dream is to have her own stores in two markets. She wants to invest in her business by buying used clothing wholesale.

It is for these reasons that Mary is applying for a loan in order to purchase second-hand clothing wholesale and open a new store.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes in bulk and to open a new shop.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de corta edad, él trabaja mucho para poder salir adelante junto a su familia, aprendió a trabajar la tierra con la ayuda de su familia y desde hace más de 15 años tiene su propio negocio de cultivar granos básicos, tanto para la alimentación familiar como para comercializar y así tener ingresos para suplir otras necesidades familiares, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde.
El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y herbicidas, para iniciar los trabajos de agricultura de la temporada y poder aumentar su cosecha, espera poder dar un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos y extender su área de siembra.
Las aspiraciones de don Aníbal son mantenerse trabajando, cancelar su deuda, dar a sus hijos educación de primera y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anibal lives with his partner and two young children. Anibal works hard in order to move forward with his family. He learned to work the land with the help of his family and has had his own business growing basic grains for 15 years. He grows the grains both to feed his family and to sell to earn a profit and pay for other household necessities. Anibal works from 6am to 2pm.

Anibal needs this loan in order to buy manure, seeds, insecticides and weed-killers to start farming work for the season and to increase his yield. He hopes to grow good crops and expand the area where he grows them.

In the future, Anibal wants to continue working, to pay off his debt, give his children a good education and remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, insecticides and weed-killers to start farming work for the season and to increase his yield.

loans.name: Soroyiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
NANA est celle qui a ses mains sur le sac d’arachide sur la photo.
NANA est une malienne, âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 3 filles toutes non scolarisées. Son mari est un cultivateur.
Elle fait le stockage du riz, de l’arachide  et le petit commerce. Elle a 11 ans d’expérience. NANA s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant et revend dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’elle réalise la permet d’aider son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
Elle fait recourt  au RMCR pour prendre de l’argent cela la permet de faire beaucoup de stockage de céréales au moment propice. 
Elle est souvent confrontée au problème de mévente sur le marché. NANA souhaite  devenir une grande commençante  de céréale dans le futur.
texts.en:
Nana is the one with her hands on the bag of groundnuts in the photo. Nana is a 56-year-old Malian, married with three daughters, none of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a small retail merchant and stores rice and groundnuts. She has 11 years' experience, gets her supplies from surrounding markets and resells them in the same locations.

The profit she realizes enables her to help her husband support the family's needs. She calls upon the RMCR to borrow money so she can stock a large quantity of grain cereals at the most advantageous time.

She is often faced with the problem of poor sales on the market. In the future Nana wishes to become a major merchant of cereals.

loans.use: buy cereal for storage, to be resold later

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in skirts, tights, shorts, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc, strengthening her business for the upcoming vacation season.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is 23 years old, a single credit officer at a micro finance institution who is from the Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. He has worked in the province since 2014, earning approximately $5 per day. His parents are the rice farmers. 

Currently, Socheat is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in management at a university in the province. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his third-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the third year successfully. For his dreams, he wants to find a proper job with a reasonable salary so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fees.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 67 years old, is married and has 12 children.

John likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to save more money. John plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, John’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Armando Durarit

texts.es:
Armando, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, todos son dependientes, es propietario de una venta de textiles, ofrece hamacas, frazadas, matates, etc.,  el negocio lo tiene desde hace 18 meses lo aprendió con la ayuda de un amigo y tiene dos empleados, no recibe ayuda económica del extranjero.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar hamacas, matates, lazos, frazadas, y otros productos que le sean de utilidad para ampliar su negocio, espera poder administrar el crédito y cancelarlo sin problemas, su dificultad es la delincuencia que existe en la zona.
Espera mantener su negocio en el mercado para tener una fuente de ingresos con a la que dé a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Armando lives with his wife and three children, all of them are dependents. He is the owner of a business selling textiles. He offers hammocks, blankets, canvas bags, etc. He has had the business for 18 months and learned it with the help of a friend and he has two employees. He doesn't get any economic support from abroad. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase hammocks, canvas bags, blankets and other products that will be useful to expand his business. He expects to be able to manage the loan and pay it off without any problems. His difficulty is the crime that is in the zone.

He hopes to maintain his business in the market to have a source of income with which to give his family a more respectable life.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks, canvas bags, blankets and other products which will be useful to expand his business.

loans.name: Migdalia  Del Fatima

texts.es:
Migdalia se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, entusiasta y emprendedora, tanto así que hace más de 5 años, decidió abrir un negocio en su casa de habitación, en el cual ofrece productos  cosméticos y  ropa. Con el tiempo las ganancias aumentaron y se convirtió en un negocio rentable, ya que los clientes la prefieren a ella.  
Por eso, solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más productos como: maquillaje, perfumes, ropa, desodorantes, limpiadores y desinfectantes de piso etc. El cual le servirá para ofrecer mayor variedad  y cubrir la creciente demanda a estos artículos. Entre los planes de Migdalia, esta seguir aumentando su producción con futuros préstamos.
texts.en:
Migdalia is characterized as a hard-working, enthusiastic, and enterprising woman, so much so that 5 years ago she decided to open a business in her house where she sells cosmetics and clothing. With the passing of time, her earnings increased and it became a profitable business, since her customers prefer her.

For this reason, she asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of more products such as makeup, perfume, clothing, deodorants, floor cleaners and disinfectants, etc. which will serve her to offer a wider variety and meet the growing demand for these products. Among Migdalia's plans are to continue expanding her products with future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as makeup, perfume, clothing, deodorant, floor cleaners and disinfectants, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, tiene como negocio el cultivo de granos básicos y ganadería, ella vive con su padre y una hija, es una actividad que desempeña para poder tener recursos económicos con los que disminuye las necesidades básicas familiares.
Necesita de un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas, esta inversión le ayudara a tener todos los materiales necesarios para iniciar los trabajos de siembra, espera obtener una cosecha abundante y de calidad para que su producto sea vendido a un mejor precio y así tener buenas ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir mejorando su negocio, ampliar el área de cultivo y lograr que en su hogar existan menos necesidades.
texts.en:
Andrea has as a business the cultivation of basic grains and animal husbandry. She lives with her father and a daughter. This is work she does to be able to have economic resources to help reduce the basic needs of her family.

She needs a loan to purchase agricultural supplies. This investment will help her to have all the necessary materials to begin the work of planting. She hopes to get an abundant harvest of good quality so that her products will be sold at a better price and in this way to have good earnings.

Her aspirations are to continue improving her business, expand the area of cultivation and manage to have fewer needs in her home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies. This investment will help her to have the necessary materials to start the work of planting.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 55 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Philip likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Philip plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Philip’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 60-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Joseph has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Joseph described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Joseph’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jamaluddin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Jamaluddin. Jamaluddin lives in West Bogor, West Java, around 2-3 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two sons. Jamaluddin owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and sells mobile airtime credits to his community.  His community sees Jamaluddin as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Jamaluddin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Jamaluddin’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Jamaluddin is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell.

loans.name: Raphael's Group

texts.en:
Raphael's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Raphael, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. Raphael has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Raphael isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Raphael will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Raphael's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Phanice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 71 years old, is married and has 2 children. Phanice has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Phanice isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Phanice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Phanice's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20-year-old single man, who has been the sole breadwinner for five other family members for the last four years. He is still working hard in his industrial equipment factory in order to cover their increasing living costs.

Ali was very young when he started in this business. It was his father's business, which he had to handle, manage and develop alone to cover his family's needs. He is a hardworking man with a very good reputation in his region, and he is in high demand. He always works on developing his business as much as he can to make sure he can respond to his customers' needs.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy some machines that are necessary for the proper development of his business.

He hopes to be able to expand and to develop his business so that he can fulfil most of his customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy some machines that are necessary for the proper development of his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale to open a permanent shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella tuene un taller de costura desde hace mas de 20 años, comenzó su negocio con una maquina, ahora  tiene tres con las cuales logra salir con los pedidos que le solicitan, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  telas de diferentes estilos y colores, botones, elásticos, zippers entre otra variedad de materiales que utiliza para su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Margarita is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has run a sewing workshop for over 20 years. She started her business with one sewing machine and she now has three which she uses to fulfill the orders she receives. With what she makes from her work and with her husband's help they manage to get ahead. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of fabrics in different styles and colors, buttons, elastic, zippers and other materials she uses for her work, in order to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in different styles and colours, buttons, elastic, zippers and other materials

loans.name: Francisca De Los Angeles

texts.es: Francisca de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su hija mayor le ayuda en las ventas, con lo que obtiene de  ganancias de su trabajo y con la ayuda de esposo  logran salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Francisca está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cal y maíz por quintales para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas  y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She sells tortillas and her eldest daughter helps with sales. With what she earns from her work and with her husband's assistance they can cope with the household expenses. 

Francisca is requesting a loan for the purchase of lime and corn per hundredweight so she can continue preparing tortillas and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase lime and corn per hundredweight

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina, está satisfecha con los resultados de la cosecha, pues con el préstamo anterior se pudo comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para darle un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos, su familia goza de mejores circunstancias de vida y ha cancelado su deuda.
Es evidente el espíritu de superación que Angelina mantiene para seguir trabajando, es por tal razón que está solicitando un nuevo crédito que en esta ocasión utilizara para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, espera continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en: Angelina is satisfied with the results of the harvest, as with the previous loan she was able to buy the fertilizers necessary to give her crops healthy development.  Her family enjoys better living conditions and has paid off debt.  It is obvious that the desire to succeed motivates Angelina to keep working.  It is for this reason that she is soliciting a new loan that she will use to buy pigs, as well as feed to nourish them, as she hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and the food to nourish them, as she hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.name: Yanis Damiry

texts.es:
Yanis, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 10 años y 8 años, los 2 están estudiando,

Yanis, se dedica al cuidado de cerdos y ganado desde hace 5 años de experiencia, actividad que aprendió de su padre y esposo, también se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pues su madre se los enseño.

Yanis, invertirá el crédito para comprar un cerdo y alimento para el ganado, los cerdos y las aves de corral.

El sueño de Yanis, es ayudarles a sus hijos para que logren ser profesionales y a tener un nivel de vida adecuado.
texts.en:
Yanis is 30 years old. She studied until ninth grade, is married, and has two sons aged 10 years and 8 years, who are both studying,

Yanis makes a living raising pigs and cattle and has five years experience. She learnt this activity from her father and her husband. She also carries out the domestic chores, and her mother taught her these.

Yanis will invest the loan to buy a pig and feed for her cattle, pigs and poultry.

Yanis's dream is to help her children to become professionals and to have an adequate standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and as well as feed for her cattle, pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is a 21-year-old single man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. 

Majdi started his own business, which is a barn for raising sheep. He sells the meat and milk in the local market. Majdi would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Majdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn; this will increase his productivity and also his income.

Majdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de libreria, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "TRES MARIAS". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and  the department of Cusco.

Hilda is one of the members. She is single, 36 years old and has one child. She has a business selling grain. She sells corn, wheat and quinoa and works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has had her business for four years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell grain from. This member is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members engage in businesses such as managing a bookstore, selling vegetables, operating a grocery store, and managing a restaurant. 

Hilda is grateful to those who are part of this dream in this manner and she agrees to comply with the deadlines for repayments.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia tiene 43 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julia is 43 years old and lives at home with her husband. She has owned a small shop located in her home for 8 years. She has many customers because her prices are good and because of her courtesy when selling. With what she earns from her sales she manages to pay for some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. so she can have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman and has five kids, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Loice has operated a tailoring business for the past 15 years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with one child who does not attend school because he is young for schooling. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition from other related businesses.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Hace once años vino de la ciudad de Granada a la ciudad de Managua en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo y se encontró a un amigo que le brindo la mano dándole un espacio donde poder establecer su negocio. Siempre lo ha apoyado su familia, se dedica a brindar el servicio de vulcanización. Para seguir brindando sus servicios Luis necesita un préstamo para comprar material de vulcanización y llantas para el negocio, de esta manera podrá tener mayor inventario y mejor capacidad instalada. Dentro de sus planes futuros está mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eleven years ago he came from the city of Granada to the city of Managua in search of opportunities for work and he met a friend that offered him a hand, giving him a space where he could establish his business. He has always supported his family, and he works to provide a vulcanization service. 

To continue giving his services, Luis needs a loan to buy vulcanization material and tires for the business. This way he will be able to have greater inventory and production capability. Within his future plans is improving the infrastructure of his business.

loans.use: to buy vulcanization material and tires for the business.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucha lucha y esfuerzo,  Doña Angela a sus 58 años, ha sabido sacar a flote su negocio. Ella comenzó hace 12 años vendiendo frescos, hielo y helados en su casa,  ahora tiene una pequeña pulpería en la cual oferta diversos productos para sus clientes y que ha servido de sustento para su familia. 
Doña Angela solicita el crédito porque quiere invertir  más en mercadería para su negocio y comprar: Gaseosas, productos básicos y otros artículos para de esta manera ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias. Sus metas son seguir trabajando para lograr ser independiente y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Angela, 58, has been able to keep her business above water with a lot of perseverance and effort.  She started selling cold drinks, ice, and ice cream 12 years ago in her home.  Now she has a small grocery store where she sells her customers a variety of products, which has allowed her to support her family.

Angela's requesting the loan because she wants to invest more in merchandise for her business.  She's going to buy sodas, staples, and other items so she can offer her customers more variety and earn more profits.

Her goals are to keep working to become independent and to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy soda, basic staples, and other products

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 49-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Beatrice has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Beatrice described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Filistus's Group

texts.en:
Filistus's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, and is being represented by Filistus, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children. Filistus has been a farmer for five years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Filistus isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Filistus will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Filistus's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meats, flour, lard, drinks, etc. for food preparation and  sales.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 8 años en su lugar de residencia el cual inicio con capital propio, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and she lives with her husband. Her business is a beauty salon that she's had for eight years in her own home. She began with her own capital, and she now has many clients because she does very good work.

With the income from this work, and with the help from her husband, she is able to cover the household expenses.

She's requesting a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, hair clips, and scissors, among other products that she needs. This will help her increase her earnings and reach better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, and scissors, among other supplies.

loans.name: Reina Carolina

texts.es:
Reina, invirtió en financiamiento anterior en el cultivo de pipianes, la cosecha ha sido abundante y cuenta con estabilidad económica para ir dando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y resarcir su deuda, sigue luchando para lograr tener su casa propia.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar sandalias, zapatos y chancletas, así estará prepara para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes en esta temporada.
texts.en: Reina invested her previous loan in growing squash. The harvest was abundant, and now she has financial stability to give better life conditions to her family and to repay her debt. She is still working hard to have her own house. This time she is requesting a new loan to buy sandals, shoes and flip-flops. This way she will be prepared to satisfy her customers' tastes this season.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes and flip-flops, so she is ready to satisfy her customers' tastes this season.

loans.name: Isabel Esperanza

texts.es: Isabel de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee una pequeña tienda y tiene 18 años de tener su negocio el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner.  She has a small store, which she has run for 18 years and is located in her home.  She has many clients, especially her neighbors, and with her sales, she is able to settle her household costs.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks and sweet bread, etc.  so that she will be able to have better income for an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks and sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Cruz Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con sus padres.

Enrique, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, siempre le ha apoyado su papá y él es quien le orienta sobre el  negocio de la ganadería, así mismo le ha enseñado a realizar trabajos de campo como agricultura.

Enrique, necesita el crédito para comprar 3 vacas para engordarlas y luego venderlas, de esta manera pretender incrementar sus ganancias.

Dentro de sus aspiraciones esta, ser un ganadero reconocido dentro de su zona; y algún día formar una familia.
texts.en:
Enrique is 22 years old. He studied until sixth grade, is single and has no children, and currently lives with his parents.

Enrique has made a living buying and selling cattle since about five years ago. His dad has always supported him and it is he who advises him on the business of livestock. He has also taught him to do carry out agricultural work in the fields.

Enrique needs a loan to buy 3 cows to fatten and then sell; in this way he expects to increase his income.

One of his aspirations is to be a recognized farmer in his district, and to one day have a family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cows to fatten up and later sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 49-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Biroglan

texts.en:
Biroglan is 61 years old. He is married and has a son and two daughters. He is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. He also raises crops and keeps two cows. His farm is small and not very profitable. 

Baloglan has worked in this area for 31 years and earns only 230 AZN. This income doesn't cover family needs because life in Azerbaijan gets more expensive from day to day. 

Biroglan applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to repair the water engine and water tank in the house because the water system in the house is very old and needs renovation.

loans.use: to repair water engine and water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de un nuevo crédito para aprovechar la semana santa para surtir su negocio y tener mejores ventas, comprara mangos, jocotes, güisquiles, cebollas, ejotes, naranjas, marañones, etc., tendrá frutas y verduras frescas para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha podido mantener su negocio con vida y los nuevos ingresos le dan oportunidad de dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Ana needs a new loan to take advantage of Holy Week to stock her business and have better sales.  She will buy mangos, jocotes, pear squash, onions, green beans, oranges, cashews, etc.  She will have fresh fruits and vegetables to better serve her clients.  With the help of her previous financing she has been able to keep a lively business and the income gives her the opportunity to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy mangos, jocotes, pear squash, onions, green beans, oranges, cashews, etc.  She will have fresh fruits and vegetables to better serve her clients.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Florence, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. Florence has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Florence isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since.
