This year, Florence will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Florence's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Battambang province, Saret is 32 years old. She is a mother of two children; one is in school and other is too young. 

To support her family, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for years and earns  about 27,800 KHR per day. 

For Saret, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing fees. 

She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay for plowing fee.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Phon is 41 years old and a mother of six children. 

Nowadays, she grows rice on two hectares and cassava on a seven and a half hectare area. Moreover, she can earn more income via growing sesame and working for others for a fee. 

For Phon, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living better than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Kratie province, Sokea is 39 years old. 

For her family’s living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for years and earns about 31,900 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay for plowing her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her farmland to get more yields.

loans.use: To pay for plowing her farm.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is 32 years old. She is married and has three beautiful daughters. 

She and her husband are farmers. They had a small piece of land and decided to raise crops there and sell the harvest. They worked in this area for 10 years. 

Now Aliya has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan order to prepare a new piece of land for raising crops and to buy new seeds and fertilizers. This will increase the productivity of the land and the income of the family. They will be able to cover family needs and other costs.

loans.use: to prepare a new piece of land for rising crops and to buy new seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a small simple house. 

Yehya started his own business, which is a barn for raising sheep, three years ago. He sells the meat and milk in the local market. Yehya would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Yehya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja de jornalero y tiene cinco hijos, pero todos están acompañados.

Francisca, desde hace varios años se dedica a lavar y a planchar ropa ajena, para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de 
su hogar, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

Francisca, solicita el préstamo para comprar una plancha y un horno, porque los necesita para continuar trabajando. 

El sueño de Francisca, es tener fuerzas suficientes para seguir trabajando y ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Francisca is 55 years old. She studied through sixth grade. She is married and her husband works as a day laborer. They have five children, but all of them have partners. Francisca has worked doing laundry and ironing for other people for the past several years, to help her husband with the household expenses. She works from Monday to Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Francisca is asking for a loan to buy an iron and an oven, because she needs them to continue working. Francisca's dream is to have enough physical strength to continue working and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy an iron and an oven, because she needs them to continue working at her laundry and ironing business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, vive con sus hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y trabajan para poder cubrir su propios gastos y aportar en los de su hogar, realiza trabajos agrícolas desde hace más de 40 años, es un oficio que heredó de su familia, lo hace en un horario de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, no representa dificultades en su negocio ni en su estado de salud.
Comprará abono, fertilizantes, semilla e insecticidas para llevar acabo la siembra de maíz, le será de utilidad para obtener una mejor cosecha y evitar el problema de plagas, espera tener granos para la alimentación familiar y para venderles a sus clientes.
 Sus sueños son mantener su negocio para tener estabilidad económica y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Antonio lives with his children who are now adults and work to cover their own expenses and bring income into the home. Antonio has done farm work for over 40 years. This is a trade he inherited from his family. He works from 6 to 3 and does not have any difficulties in his business or health.

He will buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, and insecticide to plant corn. It will be useful for a better harvest and preventing pest problems. He expects to use the corn to feed his family and sell to his customers.

His dreams are to keep his business, have economic stability, and repay his debts.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agricultural inputs to grow corn

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Living a rural area of the Battambang province, Pen is 43 years old and a mother of six children. 

She can earn income to improve her family’s living via growing cassava. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid  her past loans. 

In the group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than before.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay for plowing fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, 37, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She has four children. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for years and it earns her about 37,800 KHR per day. 

For Srey, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm. 

She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a small, simple house.

Mohammad started his own business five years ago, raising sheep in a barn. He sells the meat and milk in the local market. Mohammad would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Mohammad requests a $1500 loan from FATEN to buy more sheep and increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Muhogo Two Group

texts.en:
Exaud, who is in his mid-20's, is single. He has been running a retail shop for two years, working from 7 AM to 10 PM daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit. He uses the profit to provide for his living expenses and repay loans. He dreams of building his own house. 

He will use this loan to start selling M-pesa, Tigo-pesa, and Airtel digital wallet services and to replenish fast-moving inventory in his shop, like soap, sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil, paraffin, and toilet paper. This will be Exaud's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his shop's stock and paid back all of his loans successfully.

Exaud will share this loan with his loan group "Muhogo Two" which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to provide M-pesa, Tigo-pesa, and Airtel digital wallet services and to replenish fast-moving inventory in his shop, like soap, sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil, paraffin, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food stall, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar discos, grasa, fajas, láminas, madera, etc., para dar mantenimiento a los molinos nixtamal y mejorar la infraestructura del local, con ello busca dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar mejorando su negocio.
El crédito anterior ha tenido un resultado positivo en su negocio, manifiesta que ha recuperado la inversión con nuevas ganancias y ha seguido apoyando a su familia con los gastos de alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Ana's requesting another loan to buy disks, oil, belts, metal sheets, wood, etc. to maintain her corn flour mill and improve the infrastructure of her space.  With this she hopes to provide better customer service and keep improving her business.

Her previous loan has had positive results for her business.  She said she had recouped her investment with additional earnings and has supported her family with their expenses for food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to buy disks, oil, belts, metal sheets, wood, and other supplies to maintain her corn flour mill and to improve the infrastructure of her space

loans.name: Jaime Osmeri

texts.es:
Jaime, utilizo el crédito anterior para fortalecer su negocio, hoy en día cuenta con más ganado y mejores ingresos, su familia está muy saludable y hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades para seguir trabajando.
Requiere de más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas que le servirán para tratar sus cultivos de granos básicos, espera poder aumentar la productividad de su negocio y así mantener su progreso.
texts.en:
Jaime used the previous loan to strengthen his business. He now has more cattle and a enjoys a better income. His family is in splendid health and his business is faring well.
He does, however, require more capital to buy agricultural supplies in order to tend to his basic grain crops. He hopes to increase productivity and thus keep growing.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to tend to his crops.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, de 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque en su comunidad no habían centros escolares; está  casado y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales los primeros 4 ya están casados y los otros 3 aún viven en su casa y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, tiene 30 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, también puede hacer trabajos de albañilería desde hace 25 años, él mismo construyo su primer casa.- En la actualidad, él sale a realizar este tipo de trabajo, tanto dentro de su comunidad, como también en los alrededores de la misma.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como: hierro y cemento para utilizarlos en la casa que está construyendo.- José, no tiene los recursos económicos suficientes para terminar este trabajo, es por eso que decidió solicitar el crédito.

Los sueños de José son, darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y que sus hijos puedan superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
José, 52, could not go to school because there was none in the area where he lived. He is married and has seven children, four of which are already married. The other three still live at home with him and his wife, who takes care of the household.
José has been a farmer for thirty years, growing maize and broad beans, and a mason for twenty-five. He built his first house himself. He still works in construction both in his village and in the surrounding area.
He needs a loan to buy construction materials, such as iron and cement, in order to finish building a house. José needs the loan because he lacks the funds to purchase the materials needed to finish the job.
He dreams of providing his family with a better life and of seeing his children graduate.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Alexi, utilizo el crédito anterior para cultivar maíz y maicillo, también ha mejorado la crianza de ganado y cerdos, su nueva situación económica le ha permitido cancelar sus deudas y construir su casa propia para vivir junto a su esposo.
Está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para comprar cemento, hierro, arena, alambre y otros materiales para construir un corral en el que les dará mejores cuidados a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Alexi used the previous loan to grow corn and sorghum.  She has also improved in raising cattle and pigs.  Her changed economic situation has allowed her to pay off her debts and build her own house for herself and her husband.

She needs a new loan to buy cement, rebar, sand, wire, and other materials to build a pen where she can provide better care for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, sand, wire, and other materials to build a pen to provide better care for her pigs

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is a 39-year-old farmer. He raises and sells crops. He is married and his wife is a farmer too. They raise and educate a son and a daughter. Ilqar has been a farmer for 25 years and is very experienced in this area. Every morning he gets up very early in order to care of crops.

Ilqar loves his family very much. He is a very hardworking man. He bought a piece of land in order to raise more crops and increase harvest and income. 

Now he applied for 1,200 AZN loan in order to install an irrigation system and water crops. He wants to provide his children with a good education and a happy future.

loans.use: to install an irrigation system and water crops.

loans.name: Los Altos 1 Group

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  Hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijol y luego cultivó café. Esta producción de café es lo que le genera mayor ingreso y la vende en pergamino húmedo y seco en el mercado local. Para darle mantenimiento a su finca ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 4,000 lempiras en forma grupal, con el cual va comprar abonos y fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para fertilizar su finca y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es tener una finca certificada de calidad para la exportación. El grupo se llama Los Altos 1, formado por 3 miembros, que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad y han solicitado un préstamo grupal por 13,000 lempiras para fertilizar su cultivo. En la foto a la izquierda esta Jesús, Eusebio y Manuel a la derecha.
texts.en: Jesús, 26, has a common-law wife and together they have a son. The family lives in a town called Gracias, in the department of Lempira. He has been a farmer for over ten years, growing maize, broad beans, and coffee. The latter is the one that generates the most income. Jesús sells the beans, wrapped in humid parchment or dry parchment, at the local market. Jesús, backed by a group, asks for a loan of 4,000 lempiras. He will use it to tend to his crops by buying supplies such as manure and fertiliser, as well as by hiring help to spread fertiliser. He hopes for an increase in production. His dream is to have his crops certified as being of export quality. The group of borrowers is called Los Altos 1 and is comprised of three members, all of whom are farmers and live in the same town. In total, the group asks for 13,000 lempiras to tend to their respective crops. In the picture, from left to right: Jesús, Eusebio, and Manuel.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to hire help.

loans.name: Jose Roxaen

texts.es:
José, es una persona soltera, vive junto a su familia, como una forma de cubrir sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia, trabaja en el campo cultivando granos básicos y practica la crianza de ganado, cuenta con experiencia y no representa ningún problema para continuar trabajando.
Invertirá en ganado para tener un mejor inventario, así podrá seguir generando ingresos y ampliando su negocio, espera poder disminuir las necesidades familiares y cancelar su deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son ser una persona reconocida por su negocio y en la sociedad por ser alguien con deseos de superación.
texts.en: José is a single person who lives with his family. As a way of covering his personal expenses and supporting his family, he works in the field growing basic grains and practices raising cattle. He has experience and there is no problem preventing him from working. He will invest in cattle to have better inventory and thus be able to keep earning income and expanding his business. He hopes to be able to reduce the family needs and repay his debt. His aspirations are to be a person recognized for his business and, in society, as being someone with a desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in cattle to have better inventory and thus be able to keep earning income.

loans.name: Francisca Gumercinda

texts.es:
Dicen que para cocinar un plato sabroso la mejor receta es tener  pasión. Doña Francisca es una mujer de 53 años que por más de 30 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de pan y nacatamales, los cuales comercializa de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Ella inicio esta actividad luego de que aprendió en un antiguo trabajo a realizar ambas comidas. Esta labor le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Su único apoyo son su esposo y una hija que la ayuda en la venta de sus productos.

Doña Francisca solicita el crédito porque desea invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan  y nacatamales como son: harina, levadura, manteca, maíz, carnes, verduras, especias, etc. esto con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de sus productos, diversificarlos y tener mejores ganancias. Sus metas son ofrecer comidas de calidad a sus clientes, aumentar su producción y darse a conocer en todo su municipio.
texts.en:
They say that to cook a delicious dish, the best recipe is a passion for cooking. Francisca, 53, has been baking bread and making nacatamales, which she sells door-to-door in her village. She started her own business after learning how to make both products in a previous job. This enables her to support her family. She can only lean on two people for support: her husband, and a daughter, who helps her sell her products.
Francisca asks for a loan because she wants to buy ingredients to make bread and nacatamales: flour, leavening powder, butter, maize, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. Her aim is to improve the quality of her products, to increase variety and to have a better income. Her goals are to sell high-quality food, to increase production and to become known in the whole town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
Miguel Eduardo es un hombre de 23 años de edad, está casado y tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre once años y dos meses, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel Eduardo para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica  a la venta de accesorios para celulares, este negocio lo tiene el desde hace un año, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica también a la albañilería, él cuenta que gracias a estas dos labores ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Miguel Eduardo  desde hace algún tiempo había decidido surtir mejor  su negocio pero él no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder hacerlo, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar mil discos, audífonos, estuches, para brindarle a la clientela un mejor  servicio.
El gran sueño de Miguel Eduardo es que su negocio prospere para el beneficio de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Eduardo is a 23 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with two children who are 11 years old and two months old. He lives in the community of Sololá.

To earn income and support his family, Miguel Eduardo is dedicated to selling cell phone accessories. He has had this business for one year but to improve his income he is also dedicated to masonry. He says that thanks to these two jobs he has managed to support his family.

Miguel Eduardo some time ago decided to stock his business better but he does not have sufficient capital to be able to do this. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will be used to buy 1000 discs, headphones and cases to provide his customers with better service. Miguel Eduardo's dream is that his business prospers benefiting his dear family.

loans.use: to buy and sell discs, headphones and cases.

loans.name: Voern

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Voern is 29 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and other one is too young. To earn a living for her family, she grows rice on one hectare area and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 33,300 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland so it is bigger than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Srein

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Srein is 32 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and one is too young. She grows rice on one and half hectares area as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in both businesses for ages and they earn her about 33,300 KHR per day. 

For Srein, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely and improved her living conditions at a gradual pace. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes that she can get more income to upgrade her rice farm to make it bigger than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children from Kratie province, Sokhom is 44 years old. She overcomes her family’s hardship via growing cassava and rice cropping. She can earn income of about 35,800 KHR per day. 

For Sokhom, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer to support her on her cassava farm. She hopes that her cassavas grow well and she gets a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her on her cassava farm.

loans.name: Vansai's Group

texts.en:
Vansai, 29, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. She sells porridge as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via making tables and pig-raising. 

For Vansai, this is her third cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to buy more piglets. She hopes that she can get more income to update her business and make it bigger than before,

loans.use: To buy more piglets.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es:
Eduardo de 28 años de edad,  casado con dos hijos menores de edad, el cual uno de ellos ya asiste a la escuela primaria, es originario de  Managua y se caracteriza por ser trabajador, perseverantes,  con ganas de superación personal, él tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta la secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera, el cual no pudo ser debido a las dificultades económicas que atravesaban sus padres. En la actualidad luchan para que sus hijos tener un futuro mejor  y ayudarlos  a cumplir sus sueños y metas como es formar a sus hijos. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir tiene como actividad económica una tapicería, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene cinco años de desempeñarse en dicha actividad, el dedica a su negocio unas  doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios de tapicería, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar material como: goma , espuma, látex, pega, esponja, tela, cojines etc. Para aumentar su clientela y su calidad de trabajo, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Eduardo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Eduardo, age 28, is married and has two minor children.  One of them now goes to elementary school.  He is from Managua, and he is known for being hard-working and determined with a desire for personal improvement.  He had the opportunity to go to school through high school.  However, he would have liked to have studied for a university degree.  He was not able to do so because of the financial difficulties his parents experienced.  He now struggles so that his children will have a better future and to help them fulfill their dreams and goals as he raises his them.

Thanks to his desire to get ahead, he has an upholstery business.  The business is located at his house, and he has been engaged in this business activity for five years.  He spends 12 hours a day on his business providing his upholstery services.  He will use the loan for working capital to buy materials like rubber, foam, latex, glue, sponges, fabric, and cushions, etc.  He will do this in order to increase his clientele and his quality of work.  In the not so distant future he will be able to get better earnings.  

Eduardo is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent way to make a living.

loans.use: to buy upholstery materials like rubber, foam, latex, glue, sponges, fabric, and cushions, etc.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman and has one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 30-year-old married man from a village near Hebron city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Eyad started his own business which is a barn for raising sheep two years ago. He sells the meat and milk in the local market. Eyad  would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Francisca Jeronima

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es una carismática y emprendedora señora de 63 años, quien desde hace 25 años se dedica a la comercialización a través de una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación. Ella siempre ha tenido deseos de salir adelante por lo que comenzó a los 45 años trayendo mercadería de Honduras para  así con su propio capital montar su venta. Este negocio le ha servido para mantener a su familia, quienes además son su apoyo. 

Doña Francisca solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir más en su pulpería y comprar mercadería como: arroz, azúcar, dulces, y artículos de verano, etc. los cuales le ayudarán a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus metas son reforzar su negocio y más adelante solicitar un crédito para construcción. Asimismo, llegar a convertir su pulpería en miscelánea.
texts.en:
Francisca is a charismatic and entrepreneurial woman, 63, who for 25 years has been dedicated to selling from a small shop that is in her home. She always has had a desire to get ahead so she started at 45 years of age bringing merchandise from Honduras with her own capital to sell. This business has served to support her family who also support her.

Francisca is requesting the loan since she wishes to invest more in her store and buy merchandise like rice, sugar, sweets and summer items, etc. which will help her to satisfy the needs of her customers and obtain better income. Her goals are to reinforce her business and in the future request a loan for construction and at the same time convert her grocery store into a miscellaneous shop.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, sweets and summer items, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, comparte su vida con su esposa y sus hijos, él procura que en su hogar no existan tantas carencias, su actividad económica es la crianza de ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, la familia colabora para llevar a cabo los trabajos de agricultura.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas para poder sembrar maíz, espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio para tener alimento para su familia, producto para vender y generar ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son mantenerse trabajando en el campo y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Juan shares his life with his wife and children. He seeks to have less shortages in his household. His economic activity is raising cattle and growing basic grains. The family helps to do the agricultural work. He will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs to be able to plant corn, hoping to increase the production of his business to have food for his family, product to sell and generate income to cover the family's basic needs. His dreams are to continue to work the land and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to be able to plant corn, hoping to increase the productivity of his business to have food for the family.

loans.name: Gulshifo

texts.ru:
Гулшифо 24 летняя жительница года Душанбе. Она замужем и имеет троих детей в возрасте 5, 3 и 1 года. Гулшифо дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она любит свою работу и этим бизнесом приносит в дом источник дохода. 
   Причина обращения Гулшифо за кредитом является проведения свадьбы сестренки. Ее сестренка выходит замуж и она как старшая сестра должна ее поддержать и помочь. Чтобы купить ей приданное Гулшифо обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что ее пойму и также поучаствуют в составлению семейной жизни сестры. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Gulshifo is a 24-year-old resident of Dushanbe. She is married and has three children, ages 1, 3 and 5. Gulshifo sews women's clothing at home. She loves her work and her business provides a source of income for her family. 

The reason why Gulshifo applied for a loan is her younger sister's wedding. Gulshifo is the older sister and must support and help her younger sister. Gulshifo applied for a loan to buy her sister a dowry. She hopes for assistance to take part in her sister's family life. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy a dowry for her younger sister.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalinda es una mujer que desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con sus once hermanos. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene cincuenta años de edad y ha trabajado en diferentes empresas para salir adelante. No fue hasta hace siete años que ella decidió hacer su propio negocio, estableciendo una pulpería para salir adelante con su familia. Ahora esa comerciante y tiene un cafetín que pudo hacerlo realidad al retirar su liquidación para convertirse independiente. 
Rosalinda vive una historia con una familia bastante unida, que siempre la han apoyado moral y económicamente en todo su trayecto. En estos momentos ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carne cruda, bebidas, entre otros para proveer un buen servicio en su cafetín. Su meta principal es ahorrar con estas nuevas ganancias para reparar las paredes de su negocio/hogar y cambiar el suelo de pavimento por ladrillos.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is a woman who, from a young age, started to work to help her parents with her eleven brothers. This entrepreneurial woman is 50 years old and has worked in different companies to get ahead. It wasn't until seven years ago that she decided to start her own business, establishing a grocery store to help her family get ahead. Now, she is a vendor and has a cafe that she was able to make a reality once she liquidated to become independent.

Rosalinda has a very united family who always has supported her morally and economically in all that she does. At this time she wishes to keep investing in her business so she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, raw meat, drinks, among other items to provide good service in her cafe. Her main goal is to save with her new earnings to repair the walls in her business/house and to change the floor from pavement to brick.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, raw meat, drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Ana Dalila

texts.es: Ana, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Hace 8 años que Ana ha buscado como obtener sus propios ingresos y logró establecer su pulpería para la venta de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, churros, huevos, pan, café, condimentos, pastas etc. El préstamo que esta solicitando es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos de Limpieza, carnes, embutidos y otros para mantener surtido y obtener mas ganancias.  Su meta es seguir trabajando para brindarle mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana, 35, lives with her common-law husband and their two children in a community in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.

Ana has worked to earn her own income for eight years.  She was able to set up her grocery store where she sells basic staples, cleaning products, soft drinks, chips, eggs, bread, coffee, spices, pasta, and so on.

She's requesting a loan for 10,000 lempira [HNL] to buy more cleaning products, meat, cold cuts, and other products to stay stocked and to earn more profits.

Ana's goal is to keep working so she can give her children an education.

loans.use: to stock up on cleaning products, meat, cold cuts, and other products

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
En la vida muchos tienen trabajos comunes como el de la banca, de ingeniero, de arquitecto o de publicista, sin embargo, Benedicto tiene uno desde hace doce años que lo ha hecho ver la vida por un lente. Este hombre de 45 años de edad es fotógrafo empírico, que después de no haber recibido educación formal, trabajar desde los siete años en la agricultura con su padre, haber vendido ropa y medicina, descubrió que su pasión es la fotografía.  Ahora trabaja de forma ambulante para ejercer este talento. 
Benedicto es padre de dos hijos de seis años y otro de dos meses de edad, quienes son su inspiración principal para cumplir su meta de superarse económica y profesionalmente. Él es reconocido por la sociedad por un luchador y muy amable por lo que le ha ido bien en este trabajo. No obstante quiere ampliar más su negocio, de manera que solicita un préstamo pata comprar cuadros de ampliación de fotografías a memorias USB y así ofrecer un mejor servicio. En sus planes está instalar un estudio y ubicarse en un solo lugar.
texts.en: Many in life have ordinary jobs like working in a bank, an engineer, an architect or in advertizements. Benedicto however has made his living for the past 12 years with a lens. He is a 45 year old man who is a self-taught photographer. As he had no formal training, he started to work in agriculture when he was 7 with his father. He has sold clothing and medicine and discovered photography as his passion. Now he works itinerantly to work with his talent. Benedicto is father of two children, one 7 years old and the other is two months old. They are his main inspiration in fulfilling his goal of excelling economically and professionally. He is recognized in his society as a fighter and very friendly so his work has gone very well for him. However he wants to expand his business so he has requested a loan to buy enlargement pictures to put on USB flash drives and thus offer better service. His plan is to open a studio and be located in one place.

loans.use: to buy enlargement pictures to put on USB flash drives.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Дилафруз 33 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она мать одиночка. У нее 12 летний ребенок. Ее ребенок смысл ее жизни и всю свою жизнь она посвятила ему.
   Дилафруз занимается шитьем женской одежды и этим зарабатывает на жизнь себе и своему ребенку. 
   На данный момент Дилафруз болеет, и если она во время не будет лечиться, то ее заболевание будет прогрессировать. Лекарства стоят дорого, и Дилафрузе не хватает средств на покупку. Она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом, потому что больше не кому обращаться. Поддержите Дилафруз в этой трудной ситуации. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a 33-year-old resident of Dushanbe. She is a mother of one and has a 12-year-old. Her child is the meaning of her life and she has dedicated her life to him. 

Dilafruz sews women's clothing and earns a living for herself and her child. She is currently sick and if she does not treat her illness it will only get worse. Medicine is expensive and she does not have enough money to buy it. She is forced to apply for a loan because there is no one else she can turn to. Support Dilafruz in her difficult situation. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy medicine and restore her health

loans.name: Worokia's Group

texts.fr: Lassine qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang au centre, et qui porte le boubou blanc parmi ceux qui sont debout , est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Dalakana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Lassine, âgé de 63 ans, est le père de 17 enfants âgés de 16 à 42ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Lassine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 47 ans. Lassine cultive le mais, le mil sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Lassine entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement . Cette année Lassine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Lassine cultive le mais. Lassine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre le champ de mais pour arriver à 3 hectares,et acheter un semoir. Enfin Lassine espère aussi pouvoir payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Lassine, the man in the middle of the back row wearing the white "boubou", a tunic-like garment, is a member of a group of eight farmers registered with myAgro. They all live and work in the village of Dalakana to the south-west of Bamako in Mali. 63-year-old Lassine is a father to 17 children aged between 16 and 42 years old, two of which are current receiving an education. The integration of family tradition into agricultural practices, his main source of revenue, and being able to provide food for his household led Lassine to work in this trade for the past 47 years. Lassine grows maize and millet on his plot of land, but as a farmer he must face many difficulties, such as a lack of rainfall and quality fertiliser. Lassine is beginning his first year with myAgro and he signed up due to the payment system. This year, Lassine took out a loan in order to purchase a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow maize in order to increase the yield of his one-hectare plot. Lassine has been growing maize for 40 years. With this increase in his crop yield and revenue, Lassine is planning to extend his plot of land to three hectares and to purchase a seed drill. Finally, Lassine also hopes to be able to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow maize

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Pyapy Mbarete está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, integrado por 19 mujeres, todas ellas mujeres muy activas y trabajadoras. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elena quien se dedica a las ventas en su despensa que tiene en su propia cada. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas ha ido creciendo y mejorando.
La Sra. Elena solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como, harina, aceite, yerba, azúcar, leche entre otros. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de ser alguien en la vida y crecer.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. There are 19 members, all of whom are active and hardworking women.

One of the members is Sra. Elena, who generates sales from the food pantry located at her house. Through her efforts and continuous work of making sales, she has been able to grow and improve.

Sra. Elena is requesting a loan in order to buy basic necessity products such as flour, oil, herbs, sugar, milk, and other items. She is grateful for assistance she has received because she will be able to make something out of her life and continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, herbs, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José lleva más de 45 años trabajando en el mundo de la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijol, no fue hasta hace poco que decidió emprender en el mundo de la ganadería para obtener más ingresos. Él se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le ayudaron con su último préstamo, puesto que con ese pudo comprar una vaca que tuvo un ternero y que ahora está a punto de tener uno nuevo que le permitirá seguir extendiendo su ganado.  
Este hombre multifacético de 69 años de edad está a punto de comenzar la nueva siembra, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar semilla de frijol y alambre para reparar las cercas de su terreno. Esto le brindará más seguridad a su cosecha y podrá realizar un trabajo de calidad. Al cancelar este préstamo considera pedir otro para comprar una vaca nueva y así seguir creciendo para sustentar su hogar.
texts.en:
José has been working in the world of agriculture for more than 45 years growing corn and beans. It was not until recently that he decided to enter the world of livestock to make more income. He feels very grateful to everyone who helped him with his last loan, because he was able to buy a cow, which had a calf and is now about to have another one that will allow him to continue to grow his herd.

This multifaceted 69-year-old man is about to begin replanting, so he is requesting a new loan to buy bean seed and wire to repair the fences on his land. This will keep his harvest safe and allow him to do quality work. Once he has paid back this loan, he is considering requesting another loan to buy a new cow to continue growing to support his household.

loans.use: to buy bean seed and wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar products, and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
Jesca is 42 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Jesca represents her group of six farmers in Kakamega North District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Jesca's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profit that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate.

Jesca and her group will receive a total of four solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant on a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde luchan por ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nathalia, quien se dedica a la venta de queso, y gracias a que su producto es de primera calidad ha ido mejorando.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de queso de primera calidad, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. They have taken the poverty elimination survey because they are striving to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Nathalia, who is a cheese vendor. Thanks to her high quality product, she has been able to make improvements.

Nathalia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of high quality cheese. As a result, she can continue her sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various beverages to sell.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Rafael está en su ciclo número 28, del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo unido donde todas están luchando por  un mejor porvenir para sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien hace deliciosas comidas para la venta, hace todo tipo de comidas, y con ello se va abriendo camino y ayuda a sus seres queridos. Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando poco a poco. Ella quiere poder ser alguien en la vida y mejorar en su pequeño trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para que ella pueda seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, de manera a seguir luchando.
texts.en:
The group named “San Rafael” is in its 28th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to get ahead. They are a unified group in which everyone is striving to provide a better future for their loved ones.

One of the members is Sra. Gladys, who prepares delicious food to sell. She makes all types of food, which has created a way for her to help her loved ones. Gladys is doing everything she can to keep growing and improving a little bit at a time. She wants to make something out of her life and improve her small business.

Gladys is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing her dishes. She will buy vegetables, meat, greens, condiments, and other items so that she can continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, greens, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hector Meradis

texts.es: Héctor, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, realizando trabajos asalariados en los cultivos de maíz, frijoles y café.  Esta producción la vende en la misma zona o a intermediarios. Con el fin de mejorar la cosecha de café ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y poder asistir el cultivo de café. Tiene como meta mantener siempre su finca en buen estado para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Hector is 44 years old and lives with his wife, and two children.  He lives in a village in the municipality of Proteccion, Santa Barbara. 

He has always worked in agriculture, doing paid work related to corn, beans and coffee cultivation. This production is sold in the same area or  through intermediaries. 

In order to improve the coffee harvest he has decided to request a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to purchase fertilizers which will help in the cultivation of coffee. His goal is to always keep his property in good condition so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to help in coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Ulduz

texts.en:
Ulduz is a housekeeper of 49 years. She is married, and her husband is a gardener. They have a son who is a student. Ulduz and her son also help her husband with the gardening. They raise fruits and vegetables, and then her husband sells them at a local bazaar. 

The family's income is very small, and they can't cover all of the family's needs. Ulduz applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to cover educational costs and provide her son with higher education. She wants her son to be highly educated and have a good job.

loans.use: to provide her son with higher education by covering educational costs

loans.name: Genara

texts.es: Genara is 61 years old she is divorced and she is living at her parents house because she has no other place to go Genara is mother of two but his sons are adults already and they have their own families and expenses Genara works attending a public bathroon and she is a seamstress she makes bed sheets. Genara needs a loan to buy a sewing machine to improve the quality of her work She has the necessary skills so she hopes you can trust her
texts.en: Genara is 61 years old and divorced. She is living at her parents' house because she has no other place to go. Genara is a mother of two. Her sons are adults already, and they have their own families and expenses. Genara works as an attendant in a public bathroom. She is also a seamstress and makes bed sheets. Genara needs a loan to buy a sewing machine to improve the quality of her work. She has the necessary skills, so she hopes you can trust her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Makoulat El Hana Group

texts.en:
Amira is the featured borrower for Makoulat El Hana Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Amira is a 54-year-old married mother of two children who has been preparing and selling mouneh (traditional edible preserves) from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her region. Today, Amira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying necessary raw materials (groats, yogurt, rosewater, etc.). This loan is very important to Amira, for it will increase her production and satisfy her customers' special requests. Amira is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Rima is the lady sitting in the middle, and Rania is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying necessary raw materials

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras se encuentra en el 1er ciclo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
Martina es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene una peluquería que ha montado gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio, y hoy por hoy ya tiene una muy buena clientela. Es una persona muy amable y se destaca por ello.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cremas, tintes, ruleros, shampoo, tijeras y otros insumos que pueda usar en su salón de peluquería.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its first loan cycle. They are starting out with many expectations of being able to grow and improve.

Martina is one of the members of this group. She has a beauty salon that she established thanks to her effort and sacrifice. Today she has a very good clientele. Martina is known for being an extremely friendly person.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes, dyes, curlers, shampoo, scissors, and other supplies that she uses at her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, dyes, curlers, shampoo, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 24-year-old single man from a village near the city of Hebron. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. 

Four years ago, Moath started his own business, which is a barn for raising sheep. He sells the meat and milk in the local market. Moath would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. This will increase his productivity and also his income.

Moath appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn

loans.name: Naranjaisy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Naranjaisy Poty está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender.
La Sra. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de chipas en cantidad, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group “Naranjaisy Poty” is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Olga, who sells “chipas” [cheese bread] that she prepares herself. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cheese bread in quantity so that she can solidify her business plan. This will help to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy cheese bread in quantity that she can sell.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento De Pireca Group

texts.es:
La Junta de Saneamiento de Pireca se formó en la ciudad de Villarrica, son tres personas la que conforman su comisión, al Sr. Anacleto como presidente, el Sr. Alfonso es el Vicepresidente y el Sr. Basilio es el tesorero.
La junta se inició en el rubro en 2002, cuenta con 200 usuarios, a quienes provee un servicio tan vital como es el acceso del agua. Quieren poder ir mejorando y con ello poder llegar a más usuarios.  
Pide este préstamo para la compra de una motobomba nueva para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a su comunidad.
texts.en:
The Pireca Sanitation Board was established in the city of Villarrica. There are three members that form the commission: Sr. Anacleto is the president, Sr. Alfonso is the vice-president, and Sr. Basilio is the treasurer.

The board was started in 2002 with 200 users who are provided a vital service, which is access to water. The board members want to keep making improvements so that they can reach more users.

They are requesting this loan so that they can purchase a new water pump. This will allow them to continue providing good service to their community.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, of whom two attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia de 28 años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando, es originaria de Managua, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal,  en la actualidad lucha, para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y brindarles mayores oportunidades, y poder cumplir unos de sus mayores sueños y metas como ver formados a sus hijos.
Gracias a sus ganas de superación personal tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como: perfumes, shampoo, cremas de cuerpos, body, adornos , pantalones, shroes, blusas, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, ropa de cama, ropa de niño etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. . El negocio lo tiene ubicado en  su casa de habitación y tiene cinco años de tener el negocio, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar la temporada de semana santa donde las ventas se incrementan. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Claudia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 28-year-old single mother of three minor children, two of whom are studying.  She comes from Managua, originally, and is known for being hardworking, responsible, willing to self-improve.   

Nowadays, she strives to raise her children, and provide greater opportunities, and meet one of her biggest dreams and goals which is to see her children become professionals.

Thanks to her desire for self-improvement she has as her economic activity the selling of general merchandise such as:  perfumes, shampoo, body creams, body ornaments, pants, shoes, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, bedding, children's clothing etc. 

She devotes about ten hours daily to her business, offering her products.  This business is located in her home and she has had it for five years.  

The purpose of requesting a loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and take advantage  of the Easter season when sales increase so that in the not too distant future she can achieve better profits. 

Claudia is grateful for the assistance that kiva loans provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua which enable them to acquire dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes such as:  perfume, shampoo, creams, ornaments, pants, shoes, blouses, shirts, skirts, dresses, bedding, children's clothing etc

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y luchan por poder crecer. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza con lo cual quieren ir mejorando.
La Sra. Zunila es una de las integrantes, ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos hortalizas y demás, con lo cual quiere seguir haciendo sus comidas, ya que se dedica a la venta de las mismas que Zunilda se encarga de hacer.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The group “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and striving so that they can grow. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program because they want to improve.

Sra. Zunilda is one of the members. She is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, greens, and other supplies so that she can continue preparing her dishes. Zunilda is in charge of preparing the food that has been ordered so that she can sell it. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who strives to keep growing and improving each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, greens, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a married woman with eight children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition she also operates a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more inventory of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Las Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Isabel (la segunda del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una señora de cuarenta años, esta casada y tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre nueve y veinte años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Isabel para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura y tejido de ropas típicas de su región, ella realiza estas labores desde hace veinticinco años, ella eligió esta actividad porque lo aprendió de sus padres.
Isabela es una madre que vela por las necesidades de su familia y ahora se ha dado cuenta   que una de las necesarias es la remodelación de su vivienda, porque con el paso de los años se ha ido deteriorando, pero Isabel  no cuenta con mucho dinero para poder hace la remodelación, por tal motivo se a unido a un grupo de mujeres para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar puestas, vidrios para ventana y balcones.
El gran sueño de Isabel y su grupo es conseguir el crédito para seguir prosperando  en la vida.
texts.en:
Isabel (second from the left side of the photograph) is forty years old, is married and has a beautiful family of five children ages nine to twenty.  They live in the community of Solola.

To acquire income and to support her family Isabel engages in farming and the weaving of clothes found within her region.  She has been doing this work for twenty-five years, and she chose this activity because she learned  it from her parents.

Isabel is a mother who looks after the needs of her family and is aware that one of their needs in to remodel their home because, over the years, it has deteriorated, but Isabel does not have much money to be able to begin such renovations.  For that reason, she has joined a group of women to request a loan which she will use to purchase doors, and glass for windows and balconies.

Isabel's and her group's greatest dream is to be able to get a loan to continue to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase doors, glass for windows and balconies for home renovation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting, of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is married, has 2 daughters. His wife is a teacher at school and his elder daughter learns at university. His little daughter is going to ninth class of school. He is living with his family in the Fuzuli region but, the family members have been are IDP(Internalley Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city already for 22 years. 

Huseyn has been in sales business for many years. In the store, Huseyn sold cleaning and personal products. To develop business he wants to open a food products section. For this reason he needs a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). Huseyn says “Thanks dear Kiva organization and lenders, I hope that, this loan will help to develop my business”.

loans.use: to open a food products section and increase business. In future he want help to his children in education.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She has been running her convenience store since 2014. She used to run a lingerie shop, so she has eight years of experience in the retail business.

She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into supporting her husband by generating income for the family's everyday needs. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Rima is working hard to develop her business, but her income is barely enough to cover her family's needs. It is not enough to produce profit that she can use as business capital to diversify her products. Rima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with special Spring and Summer beverages and sweets with special-offer products.

She hopes to expand and develop her business to make sure she can turn her moderate store into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special Spring and Summer beverages and sweets with special-offer products

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 52 and married and has six children. He lives in a big town in the north of Jordan called Irbid and this is where he has been running his shop. Hani opened his shop in a busy area in one the refugee camps because of the shortage in these type of markets.

Hani needs your financial help because he wants to maintenance his shop and buy more clothes to sell. He also wants to add new kinds of the clothes to increase his customers.

loans.use: to maintain his shop and to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sali's Group

texts.fr: Sali,  au centre sur la photo et portant un habit blanc au milieu avec enfant, est membre d'un groupe de 4 productrices agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Zamblebougou, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Sali, qui est âgée de 31 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 18 personnes. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer la sécurité alimentaire de la famille.  Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Sali a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Sali espère pouvoir faire le maraîchage.
texts.en:
Sali, the one in the middle of the photo, dressed in a white outfit and holding a child, is a member of a group composed of four female farmers who work and live in the village of Zamblebougou in the southeast of Bamako of mali. Sali is 31 years old and lives in a family of 18 people. Farm work allows her to provide food for the family. 

For her first year with myAgro, Sali purchased a packet of OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers to grow peanuts on her field of 0.0625 ha [0.15 acres]. Thanks to this loan, Sali hopes to be able to grow her crops.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers in order to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Mathews's Group

texts.en:
Mathews, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Mathews will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Mathews plans to use the profits he gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Mathews’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain 51 years old and lives in Mafraq. She is a married woman who has six children. One of her children is Qusai, who is studying technology engineering. He is 20 years old, and he got very good marks in his first year at the university.
 
Zain wants the best for her son; she wants to see him become a successful man. She will let him search for work and become a man who can provide for himself.

Her husband`s income is not enough to cover Qusai`s education fees, so she applied for an education loan to help Qusai cover his semester fees and to buy tools he needs for his studies.

Zain and Qusai are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to help her son cover his semester fees and materials

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary  featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is 36 years old and a married mother of 6 children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Mary has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to the best seed prices. Even though she is new to the program, Mary  wanted to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Mary  hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights, as, even though Mary decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Frania Maria

texts.es:
Nunca es tarde para aprender y siempre el ser humano necesita instruirse en cosas nuevas. Por este motivo Frania es una mujer que a sus 47 años sigue decidida en afianzar sus conocimientos. Ella es licenciada en relaciones internacionales y desde hace 5 años se desempeña en una empresa importante del país pero decidió estudiar inglés puesto que sintió la necesidad de saber un segundo idioma para desempeñar mejor su trabajo.

Frania solicita el crédito ya que desea pagar sus estudios de inglés ya que serán de gran ayuda para su profesión y le abrirán puertas para su desarrollo personal y laboral. Sus metas son estudiar un posgrado y luego maestría en mi carrera. Y sus planes son aprender inglés a la perfección.
texts.en:
It's never too late to learn, and as human beings we always feel the need to teach ourselves new things. For this reason, 47-year-old Frania is still determined to improve her education and knowledge. 

Frania has a degree in international relations, and for five years she has been working in an important Nicaraguan company. She has decided to study English since she felt that it is necessary to know a second language to improve her performance at work. 

Frania is asking for a loan because she wants to pay for her English course. English will help her in her job and also open new doors in her professional and personal development. In the future, she wants to study a postgraduate diploma and a masters in international relations. She plans to learn English perfectly.

loans.use: to pay for English courses.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea de la comunidad de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella desarrolla actividades del hogar y también cultiva café, este cultivo lo tiene desde hace 5 años, el cual vende en húmedo en la misma zona. Actualmente no cuenta con los recursos económicos para darle asistencia al cultivo y decidió solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y pago por limpieza de la finca con el propósito de mejorar la producción y seguir manteniendo la fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ermelina is 37 years old and cohabits with her partner, with whom she has 4 children. They live in a village in the community of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.

She does housework and also farms coffee, which she has done for 5 years. She sells the washed coffee beans in the area where she lives. At the moment, she does not have enough money to pay for the upkeep of her coffee crop, and she has decided to ask for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras in order to buy fertilisers and pay for the cleaning of the farm, with the intention of improving production and maintaining her coffee crop as a source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and pay for the cleaning of her coffee farm.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla is a mother of six children, and her husband works as a driver. One of her children goes to university, which has increased the needs of her family. 

Abla had worked in a sewing shop for many years when she decided to start her own business to increase her income and to be able help her husband more and more. She bought a sewing machine and started to make clothes ordered by customers and to sell them. This helped her to cover some of the household expenses, but now that her son is a university student and the rest of her children are getting bigger, the needs of her family have increased. Therefore she has decided to develop her work and increase her products.

Abla has asked for a loan to help her buy tools and thread to meet the needs of her customers and to buy a new sewing machine. This will increase her income and help her to pay for her son's university fees and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy tools, threads and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 70 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones de 35, 30 y 28 años y una hija mujer de 33 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa maternal de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, emprendedora, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la ciudad; que se caracteriza por ser un territorio montañoso donde se encuentran varias lagunas, es agrícola por excelencia, sus productos más importantes son el maíz, trigo, cebada, avena, lino, papa, hortalizas, oca, papalisa y frutas. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Flora es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño lo usa corto, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua nativa es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al frente de pelo castaño corto con gafas, viste chompa negra y una polera rosada). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que es jubilado, sus hijos ya son independientes y tiene sus familias. Su casa es propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua de pozo, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de mejorar sus ingresos la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de empanadas, venta de jugos, limpieza de automóviles, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, servicio de mototaxi y servicio de plomería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa maternal de segunda mano, como; pantalones, blusas, poleras y otros, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, visitando ferias, comercios y mercados todos los días de la semana por la mañana y por la tarde. “la venta de ropa maternal tiene gran demanda porque solo dura un tiempo y luego esa ropa queda en desuso…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mercadería que vende es por temporada y la desventaja es que no cuenta con puesto fijo de venta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de venta de ropa, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de ropa maternal, como; pantalones, calzas, blusas, poleras, etc., para aumentar sus ventas y continuar con su trabajo. Esta es la 12 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
