Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa maternal de segunda mano para abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Flora, 70, is married and has three sons, ages 35, 30, and 28, and a daughter, 33.  She's patient, enterprising, understanding, responsible, and hardworking, and a good mother.

Her business is selling used maternity clothing.  She carries out her job as a street vendor in the city.  The area is mountainous and there are several lagoons.  It's an exemplary agricultural region; the most important crops are corn, wheat, barley, oats, flax, potatoes, leafy vegetables, oca, papalisa pepper, and fruit.  The climate is temperate and the temperature fluctuates between 18 and 25 degrees centigrade during the day.

Flora is short, dark, and robust, and she wears her brown hair short and has brown eyes and wears glasses.  (She's in the front, the one with short brown hair and glasses, wearing a black sweater and a pink top.)  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks with her family; she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.  

She lives with her husband, who's retired.  Her children are already independent and have their own families.  Her house is her own; it's made of brick and cement and has a well, electricity, and gas.

Flora's desire to improve her income led her to form a bank of people to request a loan to improve their business.  Their businesses include empanada sales, juice sales, a car wash, perfume sales, soft drink sales, motorcycle taxi services, and plumbing.

Flora's business is selling used maternity clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, and other garments.  She works as a street vendor visiting street fairs, markets, and businesses every day of the week in the morning and the afternoon.  "Selling maternity clothing is in high demand because it only lasts a short time, after which the clothing isn't worn," she said.  The advantage of her business is she sells the merchandise seasonally.  The disadvantage is that she doesn't have a fixed retail space.  Her dream is to have a clothing store.

She wants to expand her business with the purchase of a variety of maternity clothing--pants, underwear, blouses, shirts, etc.--so she can increase her sales and keep working.

This is her twelfth loan with the institution in the ten years she has been in this line of work on her own.

loans.use: to buy used maternity clothing to open a store

loans.name: Evelin Sabrina

texts.es:
Evelyn es una mujer joven ecuatoriana actualmente es de estado civil  soltera, no tiene hijos,   gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos la llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo a su pequeño negocio el mismo que se trata de un centro de internet y copiadora Ahora Evelyn   vive con sus padres en el centro del  Cantón  Pujilì  ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Pujili  está ubicado en el este de la ciudad de Latacunga, este sector es muy conocido por sus tradiciones y folklor y es conocida como Emporio Musical. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
hoy  Evelyn  solicita un crédito el mismo que lo utilizará en la compra de otra copiadora para su negocio ya que sus ventas  han incrementado mas y esto ayudará a  mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Evelyn  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Evelin is a young, Ecuadorian woman. She is single at the moment, and she doesn't have any children. Thanks to the efforts of her parents, she managed to finish secondary school, but a subsequent lack of economic resources meant that she had to start working from a very young age in order to support herself. Despite having a job that takes up much of her time and effort, she spends a lot of time working in her small business, an internet café and photocopying shop. 

Evelin lives with her parents in the centre of Pujilì, which is located in the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador. Pujilì is to the east of the city of Latacunga, and as an area it is famous for its traditions and folklore, and it is known as a centre for music. Its inhabitants perform these activities day to day, and although it is a fair distance from the city, there are families who undertake every kind of activity in order to meet their needs and the needs of the community. 

Today, Evelin is asking for a loan in order to buy another photocopier for her business, since her sales have increased. This will help to improve her lifestyle and that of her family. Evelin is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador, and to Kiva for making the growth of her working and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy another photocopier and improve her sales.

loans.name: Kavundu

texts.en:
Kavundu is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Kavundu dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Clementina's Group

texts.en:
Clementina is 55 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Clementina is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by nine farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Clementina started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2009. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Clementina’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.es: María, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Concepción del Sur, Santa Bárbara. María lleva tres años dedicándose a la cría de cerdos, esta actividad la realiza en su casa donde cría y luego vende los cerdos para obtener ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de concentrados y vitaminas para sus cerdos y poder tener mejor venta. Su meta es mantener su negocio para darle mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village of the municipality of Concepcion del Sur, Santa Barbara.  For three years Maria has been raising pigs, which she does at home and later sells them to earn a living.

The loan she is requesting in the amount of 10,000 HNL is to buy animal feed and vitamins for her pigs so sales will improve.  Her goal is to stay in business and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Juana de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y queso, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus vetas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana, 37, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter.  She sells tortillas and cheese out of her home and has many customers, especially neighbors.  With the income from sales she is able to cover household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy corn and lime to continue her business and earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es:
Maria Danelia es una joven de 24 años decidida a alcanzar sus metas y convertirse en una profesional de éxito. Ella es estudiante del último año de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil y actualmente labora como asistente en una empresa de diseño de estructuras. Ella afirma que eligió esta carrera puesto que siempre le ha gustado.  Su único apoyo es su madre, quien es la que está en todo momento con ella.

Danelia solicita el crédito ya que desea culminar sus estudios mediante una especialización, la cual le ayudara a ser más competitiva y desarrollarse mejor de manera profesional. Sus metas son culminar su especialización y luego realizar una maestría.
texts.en:
Maria Danelia, 24, is a young woman who is determined to reach her goal and become a successful professional.  She is in her last year of Civil Engineering and currently works as a assistant at a structural design company.  She says she chose this career because she always liked it.  The only support she has is her mother who is with her at all time.

Danelia is requesting a loan because she wants to finish her education through specialization.  This will help her become more competitive and allow her to hone her professional skills.  Her goal is to finish her specialization and then get a master's degree.

loans.use: To finish her education through specialization.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de cuarenta y un años de edad, está feliz mente casado y tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre ocho y veinte año, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Luis se dedica  a al cultivo de maíz, cebolla, frijol y flores, esta actividad le permite a Luis generar sus ingresos y mantener a la familia, el desde hace diez años se a dedicado a la agricultura, para el trabajar en el campo es una bendición pues es un trabajo noble y honrado.
Luis en esta temporada de siembra de maíz ha decidido  cultivar pero para poder hacerlo deberá pagar el alquiler del terreno comprar sus semillas, abono orgánico y pagar la mano de obra, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que en este momento  no cuenta  con el capital suficiente para realizar el pago y la  compra correspondiente,  por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo ayudara  a realizar su cultivo.
El gran sueño de Luis es poder conseguir el crédito para cultivar este año y generar buenas ganancias para poder comprar su terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Luis is a 40-year-old man who is happily married and has a beautiful family of five children ranging from ages eight to 20.  This humble family lives in a community in Solola.

Luis grows corn, onions, beans and flowers.  The crop activity allows him to earn an income to support the family.  For ten years he has worked in agriculture; for him, working in the country is a blessing because the work is noble and honest.

In this season of corn planting, Luis has decided to grow a crop but he needs to rent land and buy seeds and organic manure, as well as pay labor costs.  One of the difficulties he has right now is that he does not have sufficient capital for the purchase and payment.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to help him out.

His main goal is to receive the loan so he can plant this year and generate a good profit so he can buy cropland.

loans.use: To buy seeds and organic manure, and to pay for land rental.

loans.name: Maria Yesenia

texts.es: María, de 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara con su familia. Anteriormente María vendía Verduras y hace 6 años se ha dedicado al cultivo y venta de café, el cual vende en la misma zona. Está solicitando un préstamo por 4,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos para fertilizar su finca y limpieza de la misma. El préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la producción y la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, lives with her partner and she has two children.  She lives in a village of the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara with her family.

Maria used to sell vegetables but six years ago she began growing and selling coffee in the same area.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 HNL to buy manures to fertilize her land and to clean it.  The loan will help her improve production and the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy manure to fertilize her land and to clean it.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Carlos is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayalti, a community with a hot climate. The residents work in agriculture, business and raising livestock. It is situated in the Province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He offers a public transportation service on his own motorcycle taxi, shuttling his passengers to nearby villages in the region. He has requested a loan to buy spare parts and to do maintenance on his vehicle so he can continue to offer great service. This will allow him to make a larger income, to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to do maintenance on his vehicle so he can continue to give great service.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en: Madiha is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. He works as a blacksmith. Madiha has been working in the agriculture sector for the past four years, in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. She is well known in her region by her good reputation. Today, she is asking to borrow a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting in her business with the aim of increasing her productivity and thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting in her business.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janette works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Janette is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Janette has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a young mother of two daughters. She is 26 years old and lives in Dair Alla. Her husband works in the army for a low salary.

Nadia did not complete her education because of her marriage, so she is working hard to provide a good education for her daughters. She sees herself in her daughters and she wants to see them become successful ladies in the future.

Nadia dreams made her start thinking of being a productive woman and helping her husband with their expenses. She started selling home supplies from home. Now she has decided to expand her work and start selling clothes, therefore she asked for a loan to buy more products to sell and so increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Harbeya

texts.en:
Harbeya is a woman who is working hard to help her husband with the household expenses. She is 44 years old, lives in Irbid, and is the mother of four kids.

She opened her own business, which is a general shop beside her home, to stay near her kids and started to buy the products which cover the needs of her customers. Now Harbeya wants to purchase more products that were ordered by her customers to sell them and increase her income. That's why she asked for a loan to help her expand her work and buy what she needs. Harbeya really needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase more products that were ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rose, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 41 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of six farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Rose is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Rose says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has learnt a lot from farming trainings, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Rose will use the profits from this season to repair her home.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 54 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosenda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosenda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en:
Daviti is 23 years old, from the village of Kazreti. He lives with his parents, who are employed in private activities. Daviti cultivates a plot of agricultural land and trades in harvested potatoes seasonally. However, he gets a really small income and has a great desire to start an additional business. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,200 GEL to purchase a special tractor. Daviti will work on private orders and get additional income.

The loan will be a great help to this hardworking man, as he tackles the financial difficulties and makes a better style of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor and start a private activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rosario has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell like pants, etc.

Rosario has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell like pants, etc.

loans.name: Fanice's Group

texts.en:
Fanice is a 42-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Fanice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Fanice described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Fanice’s Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wafika

texts.en: Wafika is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She has been working for 20 years at home in tailoring to help her husband and family financially to meet the needs of life. She is a very talented person and she is well known in her region for her good reputation and good work. Currently, to better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy a new tailoring machine and merchandise for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, thus, will improve her income and percentage.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine and merchandise for her business

loans.name: Assil Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for Assil Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and life at the same time.

Zainab is a 26-year-old married mother of one child who has been working as a tutor for the last five years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious lady who is still continuing her studies despite her profession and family responsibilities. Today, Zainab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university school tuition fees. Zainab is the first lady on the right of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Sohair is the lady sitting in the middle, and Zainab is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university school tuition fees

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 23-year-old married mother of one child. Due to her difficult financial status, she decided to start her own business in 2014 by opening her own shop for vending faux bijoux (costume jewelry) with her special selling methods and giving a high quality of products provided. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain, in addition to the customer care she offers. Today, Najwa is demanding a second loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. She states that she is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and a chair for his new salon.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 64 años de edad, es una mujer viuda que habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde tiene una panadería desde hace 35 años, actividad a la que decidió dedicarse, con el fin de obtener ingresos, porque nunca tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, y con metas superiores como la de comprar una vivienda  y sacar a sus hijos adelante, debió asumir el aprendizaje de este oficio que en ese momento no requería sino la disposición y el esfuerzo.  Marina elabora diariamente productos derivados de la harina de trigo, especialmente panes, que con su característico olor en el punto de cocción final, atrae cada vez más a nuevos consumidores; de ahí el refrán “se vende como pan caliente”. Marina ha agregado a su panadería, la venta de refrescos, jugos naturales y bebidas, atendiendo las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, por eso su negocio cada vez tiene más exigencias de capital de trabajo y con lo que cuenta no es suficiente para invertir; esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo, levadura, azúcar, grasa y otros insumos, para aumentar su producción y tener en su oferta diversas líneas de productos de panificación y refresquería. Su meta más adelante es tener su propio local   y su sueño de prosperidad es tener una vivienda propia y esto es el motor del trabajo consistente que realiza diariamente.
texts.en: Marina is 64 years old. She is a widow who lives in a town near the city of Barranquilla, where she has operated a bakery for 35 years. She decided to dedicate herself to this work with the aim of obtaining income, because she never had the opportunity to study, and also with higher goals such as buying a house and helping her children get ahead in life. She had to learn this profession herself, which required nothing but desire and effort. Every day, Marina prepares products made with wheat flour, especially breads, which attract more and more new customers with their characteristic aroma at the end of the baking process: hence the saying "it sells like hot bread." Marina has added the sale of soft drinks, natural juices and other beverages to her bakery, responding to the needs and tastes of her customers. For this reason, her business has a growing need for working capital, and the amount that she has is not sufficient to invest. This is precisely the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, she will buy wheat flour, yeast, sugar, fats and other supplies, to increase her production and offer a variety of bakery and beverage products. Her goal for the future is to have her own shop, and her dream of prosperity is to have a home of her own. This is the driving force behind the constant work she carries out every day.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeast, sugar, fats and other supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 42 years old and married with three children. With one of her children in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Myrna has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Susan. She is a hardworking smallholder farmer based in Kambandi in the Chuka area of Kenya. The 36-year-old farmer is a single mother of two lovely looking children. 

Susan has been doing farming on her 0.2 acre plot of land for more than a decade. She keeps a dairy cow and six chickens for milk and eggs. For extra income, she brokers cereals. The 29 trees planted on the land show how Susan is environmentally responsible. 

Susan is seeking a loan to purchase grains. The only way she can expand this business is by getting her hands on more grains from the farmers. To do this, she has to leverage her business and pay the debt using the returns she will get from selling the cereals. 

Susan describes her childhood as difficult. It took hard work and street smarts to get her where she is today. The environment she has been exposed to has made her very cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact that she is somewhat risk-averse with a sober approach on how she is going to spend and repay money makes her a favourable borrower.

Susan stated that she will use the increased income to pay for her children's education. Help out this single mother who wants to get ahead!

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es:
La felicidad de Abel se denota en la forma de hablar de sus logros en su última cosecha. Este hombre de 31 años de edad, padre de tres hijos, agricultor y ganadero, lleva más de 17 años en este negocio. Él se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le ayudaron con el préstamo anterior, puesto que con este pudo comprar abono, fertilizantes y bandejas de aluminio para la siembra y para salir a vender la buena cosecha que tuvo en esta última temporada. 
Ahora Abel está feliz porque se aproxima la nueva siembra de maíz y frijoles, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar alambres para cubrir su terreno y para pagar a los trabajadores que le ayudarán a hacer este trabajo. Esto le permitirá dejar todo listo para el inicio de esta nueva siembra. Al cancelar considera hacer lo mismo que hace siempre, salir a vender sus productos por la calles de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Abel's happiness is denoted in the form of talking about his achievements in his last harvest. This man is 31 years old, the father of three children, farmer and rancher who has spent more than 17 years in this business. He feels very grateful for all of the people who have helped him with his previous loan, since with this he was able to buy fertilizers and aluminum trays for planting and to go out to sell this good harvest that he had in the last season.

Now Abel is happy because the new sowing of corn and beans is coming, for which he is requesting a new loan to buy wires to cover his ground and to pay the workers who help him do this work. This will allow him to get everything ready for the beginning of the new planting. To cancel is considered doing the same that is always done, to go out and sell his products in the streets of his village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and aluminum trays.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is 35 years old, lives in Irbid and is a mother of two children. 

Reem is looking to build a comfortable life for her family and help her husband with the household expenses. And she wants to be an example of a productive and successful woman.

She started to sell household supplies. Reem is using the income from this work to help her husband to educate her kids and to participate in the household expenses.
 
Reem is thinking of expanding her business to increase her income; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Pius's Group

texts.en:
Pius is 60 years old and has 12 children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Pius is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Pius started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2010 and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Pius’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 18 integrantes, todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder ir trabajando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marcia, quien vende prendas de todo tipo de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y se esfuerza por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, y otras prendas y con ello tener los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y también poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group has 18 members. All of them have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with their individual living situations. As a result, they can work accordingly so that they can improve.

One of the members is Sra. Marcia, who sells all types of clothes as a street vendor. She is a hardworking individual who strives and works toward improving her living conditions and those of her family.

Marcia is requesting this loan in order to buy various types of clothes such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other garments. This will give her the means to help her loved ones and also satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old and has two children. Fe is a woman and one of her children is in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Fe has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 49 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Joyce is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Joyce started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2008, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Joyce’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 56 years old and has four children. Loida is married and one of her children is in school.

Loida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Loida requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Loida has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rose, who, as a group leader, is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother of four children, known by her community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Rose joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rose plans to repair her home.

Between the 11 farmers in Rose's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 39-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of five farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Beatrice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Beatrice described her harvest as poor last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 2.5 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es: Ana de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de paletas en las afueras del centro escolar que está cerca de su casa, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la venta, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas paletas por mayor y una nueva hielera como las que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her mother. She makes a living selling popsicles outside of the school that is close to her home. She has more than 10 years working in the sale, with the earnings she has obtained she has been able to succeed. She is requesting a loan to buy more popsicles wholesale and a new cooler like those shown in the photograph to be able to continue her work that generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale popsicles and a new cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds for planting tomatoes, peppers, onions, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Masika has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: En el mes de Julio del año 2013, Diana inició su negocio de comercialización de productos naturales, aprovechando su experiencia de trabajo con un comerciante de estos mismos productos que falleció y dejó el segmento de mercado con esta necesidad insatisfecha. Consiente de la oportunidad, Diana  emprendió su propia aventura y ahora no se detiene,  ella reempaca y vende a otros negocios y también comercializa directamente a consumidores de productos adelgazantes, vitaminados,  jarabes naturales etc., su negociación la realiza puerta a puerta y en un punto de venta, ubicado en su propia vivienda. Diariamente realiza su tarea comercial desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, vendiendo de contado y a crédito entre   sus vecinos de sector mientras sus compras las realiza, de acuerdo a los pedidos a proveedores con los que establece buenas relaciones para conseguir oportunidades comerciales. En la actualidad está aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor medicamentos naturales, con los cuales aspira a incrementar sus inventarios y responder al desafío de un insuficiente capital de trabajo, para invertir, ganar más y cumplir poco a poco sus metas de sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad quien es su principal motor en la vida.
texts.en:
In July of 2013, Diana began her business selling natural products, using experience she gained from a similar job with an employer who passed away, leaving an unmet need in her community. Aware of the opportunity, Diana undertook an adventure that now continues.

She repackages and sells / markets slimming products, vitamins, and natural products to various businesses and consumers. Her trading is done from door to door and on a point of sale, which is located in her home. She works everyday from 9 in the morning until 9 at night, selling for cash and credit from her neighbors when purchases are made. Based on the orders she receives, she has established good relationships to continue her commercial opportunities.

She is now applying for a loan, her first one from 'Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo,' with which she will buy natural medicines; with these, she hopes to increase her inventory and respond to the challenge of insufficient capital for her business. She will invest, earn more, and meet her goals little by little. This will allow her to raise her three year old son, who is the main driver of her life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Koffi Dodji âgée de 33ans est revendeur de chaussures. En 1996, il a démarré la vente de chaussures au Grand marché. Il désire acheter des marchandises c'est pour cela, il demande un quatrième prêt à WAGES. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien- être de la famille.
texts.en: Koffi Dodji, aged 33, is a vendor of shoes. In 1996, he started off selling shoes at the Big Markets. He would like to purchase some merchandise. To do so, he is asking for a fourth loan from WAGES. He would like to expand his business and ensure his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia  con sus tres hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home with her three daughters. She makes a living selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). Her business is located inside of her home, and has been for the past three years. She has a lot of clients due to her friendliness and the times she is open.

With the income she generates, she hopes to pay for household expenses. She is asking for this loan so she can buy wholesale corn, pork, cheese, beans, etc., all of which will help her to continue with her sales and make a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, pork, cheese, beans, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de antojitos y su esposa le ayuda en las ventas, también trabaja como albañil, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de yucas, papas, huevos, carne, maíz, vegetales y demás ingredientes para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 58 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He currently makes a living selling snacks, which his wife helps him with. He also works as a stonemason. With the incomes from his sales, he is able to afford his household expenses.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy yucca, potatoes, eggs, meat, corn, vegetables, and more ingredients so that he may continue with his sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy yuccas, potatoes, eggs, meat, corn, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Amour A Group

texts.fr: Katekere est une commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Amour A», âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers habillement dans un magasin de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des jupes, vestes, pantalons, chemises, sous vêtements, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite constuire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Katekere is a storekeeper, member of the united group “Amour A”, aged 39 years-old, married, and the mother of 5 children, all schooled. She has been selling various clothing in a store in a gallery of the city for 10 years. She asks for this credit from Hekima to increase her activities. She is going to buy skirts, jackets, pants, shirts, underclothes, etc. In this way, she hopes to build a house, school and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for the support brought to economically active women excluded from the class banking system.

loans.use: to buy skirts, jackets, pants, shirts, underclothes, etc.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun is 46 years old and lives in Kandal Stoeung district in Kandal province. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. For the past five years she has farmed rice and vegetables as well as selling vegetables to make a living.

This will be Yoeun’s seventh loan through VisionFund. Her previous loans have made it possible for her to send her children to school. She is now obtaining a 1,200 USD loan to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to school and more vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more money in order to better her living conditions and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her children to use to commute to school

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, tiene 55 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de San Luis, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos. Lleva aproximadamente 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y producción de café, el cual vende a intermediarios y es de buena calidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos e insumos para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café, y es una gran oportunidad para  sacar buena producción. Su meta es ser uno de los mejores productores de café de la zona.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 55 years old. He is single, has two children, and lives in a village in the municipality of San Luis, Santa Barbara, with his children. He has spent the last 20 years making a living on agriculture and coffee production, which he sells to intermediaries. His coffee is of great quality.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and ingredients to maintain his coffee farm; it is a great opportunity to bring about greater production. His goal is to be one of the best coffee producers in the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and ingredients in order to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Angela De Jesus

texts.es: Ángela de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de uso personal (perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, etc.), tiene varios años de tener su negocio el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos,  ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas variedad de mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Angela is 36 years old, and she lives in her own house with her parents. She makes a living selling clothing, shoes, and personal products (perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc.). She has had her business for many years, and it is located in her home. She has many customers due to the variety of her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy a greater assortment of merchandise at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales and, that way, improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and personal products (perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc.).

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Josephine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Josephine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Josephine's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jameili

texts.en:
Jameili is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. She is acquiring this loan to pay for her child's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students with low family incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. 

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. 

Jameili hopes to stay capable of providing her children with the necessary living needs, and developing their social situation.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Karomatillo

texts.ru:
Кароматилло честный и добросовестный мужчина в возрасте 51 лет.  Он отец троих замечательных детей и заботливый муж. Они всей семьей живут в деревне дружелюбно. Он занимается животноводством  вот уже на протяжения шести лет. Кароматилло с детства любит животных. Он очень опытный скотовод. 
Сейчас он хочет расширить свою деятельность и хочет купить крупно рогатых скотов чтобы ухаживать, откармливать и продавать на местном рынке. С этим доходом он обеспечивает свою семью.  Так как он тратил свои прибыли на расходы семьи. В настоящее время у него недостаточно денежных средств для покупки крупно рогатых скотов. Поэтому Кароматилло обратился в Арванд  для получение кредита и заранее благодарит Арванд за доверие и поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Karomatillo is an honest and conscientious 51-year-old man. He is a father of two remarkable children and is a caring husband. His family lives happily in a village. He has been involved in animal husbandry for six years already. Karomatillo has loved animals since his childhood. He is now a very experienced cattleman.

Now he wants to expand his business and buy cattle to care for, fatten up and subsequently resell at a local market. The income from this business provides for his family. Because he has been spending his profit on family expenses, he currently does not have enough money to buy cattle. This is why Karomatillo requested a loan from Arvand and thanks Arvand for the trust and support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is 20 years old, a single freshman, and she is also a factory worker, earning around $4 per day. She resides with her parents in the Svay Rieng in Cambodia. 

Her father is a rice farmer, and his mother has a grocery business. Channa is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the province. 

Currently, she is lacking the finances to cover her university fees for the first year, so she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees. 

For her future dreams, she wants to work in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees for the first year.

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.en:
Faxraddin is married and has two children. He lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. 

Fraxraddin has engaged in a sheep breeding business for a long time; this is his second business. He has a few sheep; he buys a lamb, raising it and sells it for earn money. 

Today he needs 1,300 AZN to buy a new sheep for his business income. This is Faxraddin's second loan; the first loan he closed in time. He thankful to Kiva , the partner of Komak organization for the aid. I

n the future he wants increase his business and monthly income.

loans.use: to buy sheep; in the future he wants to increase his business and monthly income.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer que se esfuerza para poder ir creciendo en su microempresa, es una luchadora y emprendedora mujer, comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder comprar un congelador para su despensa, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide de nuevo este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una cámara refrigeradora lo que le ayudara a mantener de una mejor manera los productos de su despensa.
texts.en:
Antonia is striving to grow as a small entrepreneur. She is a determined and enterprising woman. Antonia says that her previous loan was used to buy a freezer for her food pantry, which was very useful.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the purchase of a refrigeration cabinet. This will help her to do a better job of maintaining the products that are sold from her food pantry.

loans.use: to buy a refrigeration cabinet.

loans.name: Nemeh

texts.en:
Nemeh is a 27-year-old married woman from a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and three kids in a small simple house. 

Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. 

She started her own business which is a barn for raising sheep three years ago. She sells the meat and milk in the local market. She would like to improve her business and expand it in the future.

Nemeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. This will increase her productivity and also her income.

Nemeh appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an additional barn for raising chickens.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, su negocio está ubicado adentro del centro escolar que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual le genera buenos ingresos, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, pollo, carne, arroz, quesillo, maíz, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 62 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She works selling food. Her business is located within the school complex close to her home. She has dedicated herself to this activity for 5 years, and it generates a good income for her. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more products such as snacks, fruit drinks, sodas, chicken, meat, rice, soft cheese, corn, etc.. She will buy all of these items wholesale, so that she can continue with her sales and have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more products such as snacks, fruit drinks, sodas, chicken, meat, rice, cheese, corn, etc., on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Arasaty 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Arasaty está trabajando con  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las integrantes se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y sumado a ello el programa de comité de mujeres les podrá ayudar mucho.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, ella es actualmente presidenta del comité se dedica a la venta de ropas dentro de su comunidad obteniendo su propio ingreso. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La Señora pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, y con ello poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Arasaty 2” has taken the poverty elimination survey. The members joined together so that they could help one another. They also said that being part of the Women’s Committee Program would be a great help.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who currently serves as the president of her committee. She sells clothes in her community as a way of generating her own income. María is improving her poverty situation through her efforts, her continuous work, and by applying the vital behaviors that are characteristic of a successful woman.

Sra. María is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes to sell. As a result, she will be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He is also a student in the university where he studies business administration. He wants to improve himself and get a higher degree of education.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies; this will help him to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Tomas's Group

texts.en:
Tomas is a 45-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Tomas has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Tomas described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Tomas’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru:
Абдумачид умный и добросовестный мужчина в возрасте 44 лет.  Женат, отец двоих прекрасных детей. Они всей семей живут в деревне дружелюбно. Он занимается животноводством  вот уже на притяжения несколько лет. Абдумачид с детства любит животных. Он очень опытный скотовод. 
Сейчас он хочет расширит свою деятельность и хочет купить крупно рогатых скотов чтобы ухаживать, откармливать и продавать на местный рынок. С этим доходом он обеспечивает свою семью. В настоящее время у него недостаточно денежных средств для покупки крупно рогатых скотов. Поэтому Абдумачид обратился в Арванд  для получение кредита и заранее благодарит Арванд за доверие и поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Abdumajid is a smart and conscientious 44-year-old man. He is married and a father of two beautiful children. They all live happily in a village. He has been involved in animal husbandry for several years. Abdumajid has loved animals since childhood. He is a very experienced cattleman.

Now he wants to expand his business and buy cattle to care for, fatten up and subsequently resell at a local market. He provides for his family with the income from this business. At the present time, he does not have enough money to buy cattle. This is why Abdumajid came to Arvand to obtain a loan and thanks Arvand in advance for the trust and support!!!

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles' Group is made up of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Charles, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 56 years old, married, and has 2 children. 

Charles has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Charles isn’t new to One Acre Fund, as he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Charles will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Charles' Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a widowed woman with six children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling meat goat to the neighbours in the community and people at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat to sell

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Julia will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Julia plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Julia’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Promise Land Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Lydia, a member of Promised Land Self Help Group. She is thirty-seven years old, married, and has seven children. 

Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. Trainings on enterprise and financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run and manage her business well. 

She is borrowing fifteen thousand shillings to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and hybrid seeds. This will help boost her crop yield, hence increase her income. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is 32 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. The IDP family (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city now lives in the Fizuli region. 

Samir has been breeding sheep for 5 years, with his mother to help him. She produces dairy products (yogurt, cheese, cottage cheese and so on). 

Then Samir sells these products and earns money. Today he needs a loan to buy lambs to increase his business. 

Therefore, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Samir hopes that this loan will stimulate his business. He offers great thanks for everything to the Kiva organization and lenders. 

In the future he wants build a house and to get married.

loans.use: to buy lambs to increase his business, in future he want build a house and to get married.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir is 39 years old, married, and has two children. The elder child is 11 years old and goes to fifth class of school; another child also is school aged, she goes to third class. 

Nazir is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city and now is living in Fuzuli region with his lovely family. Nazir is a taxi driver; he has been at that business for seven years. 

Today Nazir has applied for a loan in amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan he wants to repair his car motor. 

He says thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair car motor, increase monthly income, in the future he wants to change car

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
Zumrud is a 55-year-old woman. She is married and has two strong and smart sons. Her husband is a labourer and earns money somehow. Zumrut earns money raising and selling vegetables. She has worked in this field for 28 years and has good skills. 

Zumrud's monthly income is 200AZN and doesn't meet the life demands. Zumrud is a refugee, and together with her family lives in an IDP settlement. She is a very hardworking woman and wants to provide her family a calm and good life. Every morning she drives with her husband to the local bazaar to sell the harvest. 

She applied for a 1,500AZN loan in order to buy a place at local bazaar and sell the harvest there.

loans.use: to buy a place at the local bazaar and sell harvest there

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a housekeeper of 49 years. She is married and her husband is a seller in a local shop. They have a son and a daughter and raise them. They have land and raise fruit trees. Arzu takes care of the trees and harvests properly. 

She likes her job very much and likes to help her husband. Her monthly income from gardening is only 190AZN. Her son helps to raise fruits and her daughter helps to make fruit jam and sell it, too. 

Arzu applied for 1,500AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools so she can teach her daughter to raise fruit, too.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo nuevo que se formó gracias a la iniciativa de  una de las integrantes de este grupo, todas son mujeres jefas de familia, muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas. Todas estas mujeres son mujeres ingeniosas y trabajadoras.
Entre ellas se puede mencionar a la Sra. Juanita, quien se caracteriza por ser independiente y trabajadora, tiene montada una despensa en su propia casa donde acuden todos los vecinos, debido a su buena atención y calidad de sus productos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes, panificados y otros, para un mejor abastecimiento de la comunidad.
texts.en:
This committee is a new group that was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members. All of the members are the heads of their families. They are hardworking and self-sacrificing. In addition, all of these women are ingenious and industrious.

One woman who should be mentioned is Sra. Juanita, who is known for being independent and hardworking. She established a food pantry in her home. All of her neighbors go to her because of the good service and the quality of her products.

Juanita is requesting a loan in order to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, baked goods, and other items so that she can have the best selection to offer her community.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Elena Dinora

texts.es: Elena de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Elena is 46 years old and lives in her own house with family members.  She works in the sale of personal use products.  Her business has been located in her home for three years.  With her sales she has been able to cover some home expenses.  She is asking for a loan for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants etc. wholesale in order to continue with her business and to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant etc wholesale.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto, tiene la edad  de 64 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijo los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra del cultivo de café y así que tenga una buena desarrollo, y de un almácigo con un buen desarrollo y sanidad adecuada, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Alberto is 64 years old, is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his priority.  With his loan he would purchase fertilizers and other products to use in the planting of his coffee crop.  In that way he will have a good development, and a well developed and healthy crop.  He will also pay workers for the application of the products and assistance with the planting.  In this way he can ensure a job well done.  

He would like to take advantage of the good conditions of the climate and soil of his area for this cultivation.  He can also put into practice the experience of many years in the management of coffee crops.  Besides buying better products of higher quality so that his plantation has good development and healthy plants as well as an adequate crop he will also have important production in the short term.  

With the revenue from the crop that he hopes to obtain he will support the well being and studies of his family.  He also hopes to fulfill some family goals and continue investing in the crops. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan more easily and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to support his coffee crop.

loans.name: Josefa Alcira

texts.es: Josefa de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is 33 years old and lives in her own home along with her mother. She has been managing a bakery that is located at her place of residence for the past two years. Josefa has many customers because of the quality of the bread she produces. With the income she generates, she is able to stay ahead of her household expenses.

Josefa is requesting a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, yeast, baking molds, and other supplies so that she can continue her work. As a result, she will have more earnings so that she can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, baking molds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola de 52 años, es una confeccionista desde hace 15 años, despues de haber obtenido experiencia como empleada en una empresa de confecciones, de donde se retiró para presatr el servicio de maquila  a empresas medianas y a confeccionistas y trabaja tambien individualmente costura de ropa familiar, a la medida. Entre los productos que ofrece son sueteres , uniformes, camisueteres, camisetas tipo polo, blusas, pantalonetas etc. En su negocio trabaja las operaciones de diseño, corte y cconfección, además de coser las que vienen cortadas desd las empresas con las que establece las negcociaciones. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará una máquina recubridora y una fileteadora, con el fin de mejorar los tiempos productivos y enfocarse en un mejor acabado de la prenda en los bordes.  Sus ventas las realiza 50% de contado y 50% a crédito, trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, de lunes a domingos y sus principales clientes son colegios cercanos, familias de su alrededor,  y microempresas en general. Su meta es contar con las máquinarias de última generación y finalmente tener su propia vivienda , pues como madre cabeza de familia debe trabajar de manera cosnistente para sacar adelante a su familia y esto es justamente su mayor desafio de vida
texts.en:
Fabiola, 52 years old, has been a seamstress for the past 15 years, after having gotten experience as an employee at a sewing business, where she left to work sewing for medium-sized businesses and to seamstresses who also work individually to make family clothing to order.  Among the products she offers are sweaters, uniforms, sweater-shirts, polo shirts, blouses, shorts, etc. In her business there are designers, cutters, and seamstresses, in addition to sewing items that come cut from the businesses with which they have business agreements. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a serger and a cutting machine, with the goal of improving the productive time and focusing on a better finish of the clothing on the edges. Her sales are 50% in cash and 50% on credit, she works from 8 in the morning to 10 at night, from Monday to Sunday and her primary customers are nearby schools, families in the area, and general small businesses. Her goal is to have the latest machines and in the end to have her own house since as a female head of household she has to work constantly to get her family ahead and this is really her greatest challenge in life.

loans.use: to purchase a slicing machine and a serger.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
With the dream of getting ahead and achieving the best for her family, Getrude has been farming for the past 10 years. 

She is a smallholder Kenyan farmer making a living off dairy, poultry, maize, and some small business. 

She started farming 7 years ago when she tied the knot with her better half. She did it to help her husband put food on the table for their family. 

Getrude had a difficult childhood growing up in a poor family. She has become hardened to the realities of life, but she is deeply worried about her children's future. 

She struggles everyday to afford education to ensure that her children lead a more comfortable and fulfilling life. 

With this request, she is seeking a 40,000 KES loan to purchase several head of poultry. The brood of chickens will lay eggs that will generate income for Getrude through sales and the hatching of chicks. 

She will use the money from the sale of eggs to pay all her expenses, including loan debt and her children's education. She will continue working on the half-acre farmland. 

Getrude's family will be very grateful for the loan that will go a long way to improving their lives.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group made up of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010.
