This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Byram's Group

texts.en:
Byram's Group is made up of 9 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Byram, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. Byram has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Byram isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. 

This year, Byram will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Byram's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jane. She is a smallholder Kenyan farmer making a living off dairy, poultry, and maize farming. She started farming 21 years ago when she tied the knot with her better half. She did it to help her husband put food on the table for their family.

She is seeking a 20,000 KES loan to purchase several head of poultry. The brood of chickens will lay eggs that will generate income for Jane through sales and the hatching of chicks. She will use the money from the sale of eggs to pay for her expenses; including the loan debt, and her children's education.

Please support this mother who has 11 children to care for!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Slaiman

texts.en:
Slaiman is married, has four children, and he is 45 years old.  Slaiman has a small business, which is an outlet shoe shop. 

His wife works as a nurse with a low income; she helps Slaiman in the household expenses. They are working hard to provide a good life and a good education to their children.

Slaiman wants to develop his work to increase his income to improve the standard of living for his family; therefore he decided to ask for a loan to buy more products and and to buy more kinds of shoes to sell to cover all customer needs.

loans.use: To buy more products and buy more kinds of shoes to sell to cover all needs of customers.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian is 42 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Lilian has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Lilian also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Lilian's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sussy's Group

texts.en:
Sussy's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Sussy, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, is married, and has four children. Sussy has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Sussy isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Sussy will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Sussy's Group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 40 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Judith is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Judith started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Judith’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Gerald's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Gerald, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 57 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  He is married and has two children.

Gerald is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Gerald says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Gerald will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is a resident of a rural village in the Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Mean Chey province. She is 37 years old and a married woman with two children still in school and dependent on her. The main source of her family's income is from selling cakes. She makes them herself and has been in this business for more than ten years. She can earn 100,000 KHR per day and her expenses are around 50,000 KHR per day.

She has been a client of VisionFund for eight cycles already. Now she is leading a group to take a loan, a portion of which will be used to buy more raw materials to make cakes for sale.

The previous loan helped her family to have a decent standard of living and the ability to send her children to school. Furthermore, she hopes this sixth loan will help her to earn more income and expand the current business buy adding more products to sell.

Note: The kids in the picture are the client’s children.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make cakes to sell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Selpha's Group

texts.en:
Selpha's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Selpha, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 49 years old, is married and has 2 children. Selpha has been a farmer for 19 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Selpha isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Selpha will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Selpha's Group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Mario Jerónimo

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre responsable y  muy amable tiene 32 años de edad, está unido con su esposa, con la que tiene tres hijos de las edades entre dos y siete años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Mario para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, trabaja como sastre en su casa de habitación elaborando pantalones  de lona para luego venderlos a los comerciantes de su comunidad, él tiene siete años de estar trabajando como sastre.
Mario ahora se ve a la necesidad de mejorar su casa, pero para poder hacerlo deberá contar con una buena cantidad de dinero, pero una de las dificultades  que él tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar block, arena, cemento para la respectiva remodelación.
El gran sueño de Mario es contar con su propia tienda donde pueda exhibir su propio producto.
texts.en:
Mario is a responsible and very friendly man, 32 years old, who is close to his wife, with whom he has three children between the ages of two and seven. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Mario, to get income and support his family, works as a tailor in his house making canvas pants to then sell them to business people in the community. He has been working as a tailor for seven years.

Mario now sees the need to improve his house, but to be able to do that, he needs to have a good quantity of money, but one of the difficulties that he has is that he doesn't have sufficient money, so he asks for a loan which will be used to purchase concrete blocks, sand, and cement for the remodeling. Mario's biggest dream is to have his own store where he can show his own products.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, sand, and cement to remodel the house.

loans.name: Huseyngulu

texts.en:
Huseyngulu is 28 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city, now living in the Fuzuli region. He is single and lives with his parents and sister. After his military service he decided that continue the family business and, since then, has been in the animal breeding business.

Today Huseyngulu needs a loan in amount of 1000 AZN to vaccinate his animals. He says a great thank you to the Kiva organization for the loan.

Huseyngulu is engaged and he wants to improve his business and his monthly income and then wants to get married.

loans.use: to vaccinate his animals, increase his business and, in future, get married.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es: Reina de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles  y demás ingredientes para poder seguir con su trabajo y así generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Reina is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter. She works preparing and selling tortillas and pupusas [traditional Salvadoran filled tortillas]. Her business is located in her place of residence. She has dedicated herself to this business for 3 years, and she started it with her own capital. She has many customers, so that with the proceeds from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, soft cheese, pork, beans and other ingredients so that she can continue her work and thus generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy corn, soft cheese, pork, beans and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is 31 years old. She is a refugee and married with a son and two daughters. They live in an IDP settlement and have a hard life. Nazakat earns money raising and selling poultry. She has worked for 18 years and is well experienced for her age.

Nazakat's family is very poor. They can hardly cover the family's demands. They need to increase their income and be able to meet their needs. Nazakat wants to expand her small business in future. She applied for a loan in order to repair the old hen house and supply good feed for her poultry.

loans.use: to repair the old hen house and supply good feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposa y su hijo, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 40 years old and lives with his wife and child. He has a metal shop where he makes doors, balconies, window bars and more. He has been working in this business for more than 8 years and has a lot of experience which helps him to improve his work each day. He now has many customers because they seek him out for the quality of his work, for his accessible prices, but above all because he always does his work to the customer's taste. He asks INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow him to purchase iron, metal, tools, etc. and in this way be able to continue with his work to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Ricardo Ivan

texts.es:
Ricardo, de 33 años de edad casado con dos hijos menores, los cuales estudian en los cursos de primaria. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable,  con ganas de superación personal, además es el único sostén de su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos, y se puso a trabajar con su papa en la tapicería el negocio lo heredo de su papa el cual le enseño dicho oficio. En la actualidad lucha día a día para sacar adelante a sus hijos y cumplir sus metas y sueños como es tener una casa propia y formar a sus hijos en profesionales y que tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracia a su perseverancia tiene por actividad económica una tapicería, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, el dedica a su negocio unas diez horas ofreciendo sus servicios para aumentar  y mantener su clientela y en un futuro obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en material de trabajo para la tapicería como. Cuero, tela, esponja, pega, cojines, forros, etc.  Ricardo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 33 years old. He is married, and he has two small children who are in elementary school. He is characterized as hard-working and responsible with a desire for self-improvement. In addition, he is the sole supporter of his family.

Unfortunately, he was not able to study due to a lack of resources. Instead, he started working with his father on upholstery. He inherited this business from his father who taught him about the work. Currently, he fights day after day in order to move his children forward and to achieve his goals. He dreams of having his own house and of helping his children become professionals so that they can enjoy better life conditions.

As a result of his perseverance, he makes a living providing upholstery services. His business is located in his home, and he offers his services for 10 hours every day with the hope of increasing and maintaining his customer base and, in the future, of obtaining a better income. He is requesting a loan to buy upholstery materials such as leathers, cloths, sponges, glues, cushions, linings, etc.

Ricardo gives thanks to Kiva lenders for helping people with limited resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua have decent ways to make a living.

loans.use: to buy upholstery materials such as leathers, cloths, sponges, glues, cushions, linings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cases of water to sell in the market.

loans.name: Afroza

texts.en:
Afroza is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of 6 children. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her own business selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality.

In order to improve her business, she has asked for a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 40-year-old, married woman who has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She sells milk to the people of her locality. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and profits.

loans.name: Adela De La Cruz

texts.es: Adela de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca y platanitos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, Adela está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adela, who is 56 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She prepares and sells snacks such as tostadas with little pieces of potatoes, yucca, and plantains. Her business is located in a place with a lot of traffic near her place of residence. For this reason, she has a lot of customers. 

Adela is applying for a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients such as yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all at wholesale, for the preparation of these foods and so that she can thus obtain better earnings in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all at wholesale

loans.name: Thelma Candelaria

texts.es: Thelma de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de elotes, tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual le genera muy buenas ganancias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de elotes, azúcar, leche y demás ingredientes por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Thelma, who is 56 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She sells corn tamales. She has been in this business for more than 15 years, and it generates very good earnings for her. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase corn on the cob, sugar, milk, and other ingredients wholesale so that she can continue with her sales and thus have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob, sugar, milk, and other ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Lubwind

texts.es: Lubwind de 33 años de edad, se dedica a la compra reparación y venta de motocarros, actividad que desarrolla  desde el año 2010, cuando se le ocurrió emprenderla teniendo como base su conocimiento en la venta de repuestos para motocicletas y decidió agregar a su tarea productiva el comercio de estos vehículos,  con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos y beneficiar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Lubwind realiza la comercialización por internet, y sus mayores clientes son sus vecinos, que refieren a muchos potenciales compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una motocicleta , para pintarla y venderla, con esto aumentará las utilidades de su negocio, pues planea un futuro de bienestar para su hijo, con quien sueña sea un profesional exitoso.
texts.en:
Lubwind, who is 33 years old, buys, repairs, and sells light, three-wheeled delivery vans, a business that he has been running since 2010, when it occurred to him to undertake this business, having as a base his knowledge of the sale of spare parts for motorcycles. He decided to add the sale of these vehicles to his productive tasks, with the goal of obtaining better income and benefiting his family, which consists of his wife and their little 9-year-old son.

Lubwind makes his sales by internet, and his best customers are his neighbors, who refer many potential buyers [to him]. 

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy a motorcycle to paint and sell. With this he will increase the profits from his business, since he plans a future of well-being for his son, whom he dreams of seeing become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine and to open an independent printing shop.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofia madre de una pequeña de 6 años, se dedica al servicio de peluquería en general desde hace 6 años, cuando en el año 2009, empezó su negocio despues de capacitarse en belleza y estética, aprovechando que tenia algnos ahorros para  emprender su propia aventura de negocios autonomo, vendiendo productos de belleza y  trabajando a domicilio como estilista. Hoy tiene su sala de belleza, en la que ofrece los servicios de corte de cabello, tratamientos capilares etc. En la actualidad está apicando a un credikiva, primer financiemito  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tintura de cabello, gel, pinzas, pinta uñas, cremas etc. Con esta inversión Sofia espera incrementar sus inventarios, para tenar mas insumos de consumo y otros productos para comercializar entre su clientela, con los que impactará sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.  Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local y comprar una vivienda, con loque generaría cada vez mas bienestar para su hija, quien es el motor principal, que dia a dia la impulsa a trabajar de manera consistente.
texts.en:
Sofia, who is mother to a six year old daughter, has worked as a hairdresser for six years.  In 2009 she began her business after qualifying herself in beauty and cosmetics, taking advantage of some savings that she had to begin her own business.  She sells beauty products and works at home as a stylist.  Now she has her beauty room in which she offers services such as haircuts, hair treatments etc.  

Presently she is applying for a credikiva, the first financing made by the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase hair dye, gel, hair ties, nail polish, creams etc.  With this investment Sofia hopes to increase her inventory.  Then she will have more supplies and other products to sell to her clients.  This will impact her sales and also her profit, making her credikiva a successful investment.  Her goal moving forward is to have her own space and purchase a home which will improve the well being of her daughter who is her principle motivation, who day to day inspires her to work consistently.

loans.use: to purchase hair coloring, gel, hair ties, nail polish, creams, etc.

loans.name: Jeanntt Norma

texts.es:
Norma vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad de la región costa del país. En este sector se da mucho el comercio ya que es el punto donde se unen las diferentes regiones del país; también por su agradable clima e hidrografía la visitan muchos turistas los fines de semana.  
Norma vive muy feliz en esta ciudad, ella cuenta con una pequeña casa donde vive en unión de su esposo y un hijo mayor; ellos trabajan, su esposo es cocinero y su hijo cuenta con un pequeño negocio propio. Norma también es una señora trabajadora, le gusta crecer y salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo, ella en las tardes sale a vender sus productos,  vende cosméticos y además los fines de semana fuera de su casa adecua un horno donde elabora carne asada, le va muy bien ya que en este sector es la única persona que vende asados tan sabrosos. 
Norma quiere seguir creciendo como microempresaria para en un futuro poder tener un negocio más grande y dar trabajo a quien necesite, por ello con este crédito podrá comprar un horno más grande y mejor para su negocio, también va a comprar cosméticos ya que es un mes muy comercial y quiere aprovechar para incrementar las ventas. Se siente agradecida con la institución y todas las personas que conforman Kiva ya que gracias a estos créditos los microempresarios pueden crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Norma lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city located in the coastal region. This is an important commercial zone, as it connects the regions in the country. It is also visited by many weekend tourists because of its pleasant climate and hydrographic features.

Norma is very happy in this city. She has a small house where she lives together with her husband and an adult son. They work, her husband is a cook, and her son has a small business of his own. 

Norma works as well, she enjoys growing and getting ahead through her own efforts. In the afternoons, she goes out to sell cosmetics, and during the weekends she sells barbecues that she prepares on a grill outside her home. She's doing very well since she is the only one in her area selling such tasty roasts.

She wants to continue growing as microentrepreneur, so that in the future she can have a bigger business and offer employment to those in need. 

With this loan she will buy a bigger and better grill for her business, and she will also buy cosmetics, since it is a month of major sales and she will seize the opportunity to increase her sales.

Norma is thankful to the institution and all the people at Kiva for these loans that assist the microentrepreneurs to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a bigger grill in order to sell barbecue, and also to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Enos's Group

texts.en:
Enos is 62 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Enos has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Enos also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about. It will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Enos's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Olrongai Mwangaza S. H G Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joshua, a member of Olrongai Mwangaza S.H.G. Joshua is 57 years old, married and blessed with six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.
Joshua does maize, beans and poultry farming, having gone through HiH EA enterprise training. He has been able to commercialize his business and earn profit. 
He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seed. This will increase the quality of his yield thus earning him more income. With increased income Joshua will be able to care of his family's basic needs, education and medical care.
He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to boost farming.

loans.name: Upasol

texts.en: Upasol is a social enterprise in Chile’s Elqui Valley that reinvests revenues from recycling services into the only rehabilitation center for people with physical and mental disabilities in the region. It reduces waste, benefits the local environment, and creates a brighter future for the disabled. With this loan, Upasol will in part purchase a truck for collection and transportation of raw materials and recycling products. It will also purchase equipment for improving the recycling process and expanding warehousing capacity. Upasol (the acronym for "Unión de Padres y Amigos Solidarios" - Parents and Friends Solidarity) operates a free collection service for recyclable household goods in Vicuña and surrounding areas. On an annual basis they collect 61 tons of recyclable materials. The collected glass, plastic, metal, and other reusable materials are then sold to local manufacturers for use in their production processes. The recycling revenues cover 75% of the costs of supporting the only rehabilitation facility for people with disabilities in Vicuña. In addition to funding physical therapy, Upasol also generates jobs through its collection service and employs people with disabilities at the center. 4,000 people total benefited from Upasol’s recycling services and rehabilitation center. Upasol brings visibility to both disability and environmental issues and serves as a community hub for resources and social activities. In 1998 when Patricio Santander launched Upasol, there were no services or facilities in Vicuña for children with disabilities. Parents had to take their children far outside of Chile’s Elqui Valley for rehabilitation therapy. According to the National Disability Fund, less than 30 percent of the 2.5 million Chileans with disabilities are employed; in 2014, nearly 50 percent were living in poverty. In remote areas like Vicuña, therapeutic facilities for the disabled are either underfunded or nonexistent. For example, at age six, Paola suffered a cerebral aneurysm as the result of a congenital brain defect. At the time, she was not expected to survive; now, years later, Paola is thriving with support from Upasol’s physical rehabilitation facility. “It is hard in the beginning,” she explains. “But, with drive and motivation, you pull through.” Called a miracle by many doctors, Paola now studies theology and wants to become a youth educator in Vicuña. “I also want to give back to Upasol,” she says. “I am very grateful to the center. It has given me so much.” Limited opportunities exist for people with disabilities to live independently, receive a dignified job, or enjoy social activities. Upasol is trying to change that. For more details, watch this video.

loans.use: to expand recycling capacity and operations to support its health clinic

loans.name: Nargas

texts.en: Nargas is a 56-year-old widow and mother of five children. One of her sons is shown in the photo with her. For about eight years, she is been doing hand embroidery to earn income.  She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand, and she has managed to sustain a clientele that allows her to pay household expenses. To help her to continue her operations, she has taken a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth along with reels of threads in different colors, plus beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright future and desires to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth along with reels of threads in different colors, plus beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Beatrice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Beatrice started working with One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seed. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Beatrice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia, age 39, is a married woman. Nine years ago, she decided to support her family by starting to stitch clothes at her home. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has an income that is barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shazia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she faces difficulty in covering daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has applied for a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with thread, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use:
to purchase a new stitching machine along with thread
, buttons and laces to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Stella, an enterprising and dynamic young mother. She keeps dairy cows, raises poultry and grows maize, among other crops. She is also sharpening her entrepreneurial spirit by actively running other agriculture-related businesses.

Agriculture in Kenya suffers from entrenched negative perceptions among the youth. They think it is not glamorous, since in their minds a farmer is someone like their grandparents, doing backbreaking labor in the fields and getting little to show for it.

Thus, they move from rural areas to urban ones, and most of them find themselves living in shanty towns. They are soon faced with problems that do not exist in the countryside: street crime, social inequality and discrimination. They also realize the cost of city life is significantly higher and the opportunities to produce their own food and other basic necessities is greatly reduced.

Stella has chosen to be one among her generation to end hunger and alleviate malnutrition and poverty. She is particularly interested in poultry farming. She aspires to develop this business but faces major challenges including limited funds.

It is for this reason that Stella is seeking a 30,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry. Returns from this expansion will help her deal with the high cost of agricultural inputs that cripple smallholder farmers. Furthermore, the growth of her business will bring so much joy to her husband and children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Blanca Zoila

texts.es: Blanca de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 55, lives in her own house with her mother.  She sells tortillas, and her business is located at her house.  With what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is about 100 pounds] and lime powder.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her sales.  This way she will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn by the ‘quintal’ [a quintal is about 100 pounds] and lime powder.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Senhor Armando tem 63 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos, dos quais 2 estão ainda na sua responsabilidade, e frequentando o ensino secundário, é avicultor, e vive em casa própria não sustentando mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, medicamentos, para a criação de frangos.
No futuro pretende construir mais aviários e aumentar a sua capacidade de criação de frangos, visto que os custos de vida aumentaram e o seu rendimento actual não é compatível com as suas despesas.
Como desafio deseja liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma garantir o bom nome na instituição, e consequentemente realizar de forma mais célere os seus projectos
texts.en: Armando, age 63, is married and the father of four children, two of whom are under his care and are in school. He is a poultry farmer and lives in his own home. Other than his children, he has no other dependents. This loan will go toward buying chicks, feed, and medicine for raising chickens. In the future he plans to build more roosts and increase his capacity for production, seeing as the cost of living keeps going up and his earnings are not enough to cover his expenses. His priority will be to pay back the loan without getting behind on his payments, so as to remain in good standing with the institution and more quickly realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, and medicine for raising chickens.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 33-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of 2 children. Her husband, also shown in the photo above, has been doing business selling fruit for the past 6 years on his cart. He tries hard to provide his family with the basic necessities through his business earnings. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Zareena has taken a Murabaha-type loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase a larger cart as well as inventory of fresh fruit to consistently meet market demands.

loans.use: to purchase a larger cart as well as inventory of fresh fruit.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth leads a 7-member group  in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children.  She is known by her community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Ruth joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. Ruth will use the profits to buy a goat.

The 7 farmers in Ruth's Group will plant a total of 2.75 acres of land  using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will purchase a solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollos, tiene más de 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Blanca está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, pollos, verduras  y demás ingredientes por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is 44 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. She sells chicken tamales. She has been doing this activity for 6 years. With her sales she has been able to pay for some of her household expenses. Blanca is asking for a loan to buy corn, chickens, vegetables and other ingredients wholesale so she can have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, and other ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Josphine's Group

texts.en:
Josphine is a group leader and represents her 8-member group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

 Josphine will purchase maize seed, fertilizer, and a solar light. The solar light will help her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Josphine plans to use the profits to send her children to school.

Josphine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed, fertilizer , and a solar light.

loans.name: Fitat

texts.en:
Fitat is a 38-year-old  refugee  who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is married and has two sons. They grow apples, pears, and plums to sell at the local bazaar.  

Fitat also makes delicious, healthy jam and dried fruits.  Fitat applied for 1,000 AZN to buy a new engine for her lawn mower.   She loves to garden and enjoys growing trees.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower  battery.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 60-year-old woman with 6 children. She leads an 11-member  group in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Josephine has farmed with One Acre Fund for years, she joined the program in 2011. This decision resulted from  her desire to access quality training and acquire new farming methods.  Her last harvest was poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), but she believes she could have a better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Josephine also decided to purchase a solar light which will allow her to have light during the night  to feel safer.

Josephine's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights and  plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light ,hybrid seed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Laura Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Laura es una experimentada carpintera el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera de Pino que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en su hija, puesto que quiere darle una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sea muy exitosa.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Laura is an experienced carpenter.  She learned this trade many years ago thanks to the teachings of her father.  With the passage of time she became independent.  She established her own shop with which, in spite of the adversities, she has managed to get ahead together with her family.

Her greatest pride is having built a very good reputation and prestige thanks to her good work.

She is requesting a loan to buy pinewood.  This will allow her to make more furniture and to manage to have good profitability from her work.

Her main dream is focused on her daughter.  She wants to give her a good education so that she will be very successful in the future.

She always thinks of Interactuar as her ally and companion in her productive process.

loans.use: to buy pinewood.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 19 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como jeans, camisas, camisetas, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 3 horas.

Maria tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en: Maria is an enterprising and dynamic 19 year old young woman. She goes to college and is an independent saleswoman, because two years ago she started selling merchandise to her relatives, friends and college classmates in order to generate income to help with her household finances and to pay for her studies. She is requesting the loan as a help to strengthen her business, because she will invest the money to buy at wholesale prices an assortment of clothes such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, among other things. With it, she will offer more variety and better service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable. She works three hours daily by herself. Maria has the firm objective to make her productive project prosper, because she wants to become a successful businesswoman and to guarantee a better quality of life and well being for her family; and she knows that with the Kiva lenders and Interactuar she can achieve all of this and much more.

loans.use: to buy at wholesale prices an assortment of clothes such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, among other things.

loans.name: Nheth

texts.en:
Nheth, 56, lives in a small community in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of 5 children. To earn a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of rice farmland located near her house. To date, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to earn an income of 2.00 USD a day.

Nheth wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine, because currently there is no latrine in her house. 

Therefore, Nheth is requesting a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited and Kiva to build a latrine. She will be able to help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. 

Nheth is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Yonaira Bibiana

texts.es:
Yonaira es una mujer de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

Ella monto un café internet desde hace 1 año y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

Ella tiene 26 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos computadores para aumentar su oferta. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
Yonaira is a woman with good ideas and a creative mind. She is always trying to find activities to increase her family income. She opened an internet campaign a year ago and she also sells paper items in the same business. 

She is 26 years old and she has the brains to face any of the challenges that life has prepared for her. She is asking for financial support to buy some computers to increase her supply. 

With this money, she will be able to invest in her business and attract more customers, thus impacting her profits in a positive way. Her biggest dream is to have a great internet cafe with good income, as well as to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy some computers to increase her supply.

loans.name: Shafia

texts.en:
Shafia is a 44-year-old, married woman with 4 children. She and her husband  run a business to purchase and sell animals. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them; her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Their business provide them with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses, including food, health, and clothing. 

Shafia requests  25,000 PKR to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business which will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy  goats to sell to expand the business.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima, age 51, is a married mother of 2 children. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, which is why she started her business selling animals. 

Asima earns enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

However, Asima needs to improve her business so she can support her household expenses. In order to expand her business, she has taken a Murabaha-type loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another cow. 

Asima is a very experienced businesswoman and has good contacts in the market.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 24-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She needs to expand her business for better earnings. Currently she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase another cow to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Doris's Group

texts.en:
Doris is a 49-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Doris has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Doris described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Doris’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Moatasem

texts.en:
Moatasem is a young man who has 2 children. He lives with his little family in Baqaa. He is 27 years old. 

Moatasem is an ambitious and motivated guy. He works hard to provide for his wife and kids. He opened his own beauty salon for men, and he is currently earning a good income. However, day by day, the cost of living is rising, so he has decided to expand his work.

Moatasem has requested a loan because he needs to buy supplies and a new machine for his salon to help him raise the quality of his work. This will help him to develop and expand the salon, as well as increase his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a new machine for his salon to help him raise the quality of his work.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working since 2009, selling homemade food to help her family to meet the needs of life and to improve their lifestyle. Today, Haifa is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., to improve her business merchandise in order to give the best product to her clients, and to maintain a good reputation in her hometown. She is very certain that she will be able to sell all products and to expand her business area.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise

loans.name: Djamako Group

texts.fr:
La dame par devant et qui a les moutons juste devant est Bagnô 
Bagnô  réside dans une commune rurale au Mali avec son mari, ex-plombier à l’énergie du Mali à la retraite et aujourd’hui cultivateur, et leurs 4 enfants âgés de 22 à 15 ans tous alphabétisés.
Bagnô est une emboucheuse non instruite, elle mène cette activité d’embouche ovine depuis 10 ans et souhaite de cela devenir dans les jours à venir un grand éleveur dans le but d’avoir une capacité financière nécessaire pour mieux préparer l’avenir de ses enfants.
C’est dans cette optique qu’elle a désiré de recourir au prêt RMCR ; et pour ces activités, elle s’approvisionne en bétails sur le marché local et les  revend sur le marché de sa zone pendant les foires. Chose qui lui permet de générer un bénéfice de 20.000 f par tête après la période d’embouche. .
La seule difficulté dans son activité est la hausse soudaine des prix des aliments bétails.
texts.en:
The woman in front standing before the sheep is Bagnô. Bagnô lives in a rural commune in Mali with her husband, an retired ex-electrician from Mali who now farms. Their 4 children range from age 15 to 22, all of them literate. 

Bagnô is an untrained livestock farmer. She has worked in the sheep rearing business for 10 years and wishes to become a great farmer with the goal of having the financial capability necessary to better support her children's futures. 

With this perspective, she wanted to appeal to a loan with RMCR. For her business, she buys livestock at the local market and sells them back later in her regional market during the fairs. This activity allows her to generate a profit of 20,000 francs  per animal after the rearing period. The only difficulty her business faces is the sudden price elevations for livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy sheep, raise them, then sell them afterwards.

loans.name: Manegre 07 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
MR TIGA est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 07 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 11 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 05 enfants  vont à l’école et il a 08 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 30 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 25 m de grillage.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne  assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Tiga is the head of the group Manegre 07 Sapone. He is married and a father to 11 children. The oldest is 37 and the youngest is 9 years old. Five children are in school and he has 8 people in his care. 

Mr Tiga has done livestock farming for 30 years. He resupplies at the local markets. With the money he is loaned, he plans to buy 25 meters of wired fence. He wants to use the profits of the loan to reinvest in his business. He aspires to ensure his children's good future.

loans.use: to buy 25 meters of wired fence.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is in the above photo. She is 39 years old, married, and has 8 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 

Hannah practices maize and bean farming. She has gained experience in enterprise start up and development, and she also acquired skills in financial management which has helped her manage her finances well.  

Hannah is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase her crop yield and harvest thus meeting the demand of maize and beans in her area. Her improved income will put her in a position to educate her children. 

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase both hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela is the leader of her group of 5 farmers, herself included, in Kakamega North District. She is married and a proud mother of 3 children. Pamela joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 15 years.

Like many other farmers, Pamela decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

Pamela's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 2.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth, 58 years old, is strong, full of energy, and hardworking. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a place that is blessed with good weather patterns and is one of the best areas on earth to practice farming. Beth is married and has five children that she really admires and would do anything for so that they never lack for anything. Through practicing dairy and crop farming, Beth has always been able to provide food for her family and meet their basic needs. She has acquired much experience over the last ten years, and this has helped her earn profits. 

Beth is seeking a loan of KES 15,000 to buy poultry. Through the loan, she is sure that she will satisfy the demand for poultry products in Chuka, which is densely populated and has a ready market for eggs and poultry. Because of Beth's immense knowledge and the good will she enjoys with the villagers, she will not have any challenge in selling her products. Beth also believes that, through word of mouth, she will be able to get more customers and increase her customer base. Increased profit levels will translate into better living conditions for Beth and her family, and this will also allow her to make permanent changes to her life and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
Levi is 62 years old and has 8 children. He is a leader representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Levi has been farming with One Acre Fund for years, having joined the program in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although Levi described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Levi also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Levi's Group will be able to receive 1 solar light and farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is 58 years old, and she lives in a rural area of Sangke district, Battambang province. She is a widow who has 5 children, one of whom is a dependent. The sole source of her family's income comes from her work as a sculptor.

Ran’s Group consists of 3 members, and she is the leader. Ran is an existing client who has borrowed from VisionFund over 5 cycles already. The previous loans were able to help her and her whole family have a better standard of living. 

As her 6th loan, her loan portion will be used to buy equipment to support her sculpture business. She hopes to expand her business and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment to support her sculpture business.

loans.name: Elimina's Group

texts.en:
Elimina is the leader of her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is married and a proud mother of 4 children. Elimina joined One Acre Fund this season, but she has been a farmer for 15 years.

Like many other farmers, Elimina decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Elimina's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Kamissoko's Group

texts.fr: Amy qui se trouve sur la photo, assit au premier rang à gauche,elle tiens un mouchoir blanc  et est habillée en jaune et rouge bordeaux, c'est la deuxième personne à gauche au premier rang, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Kirina au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Amy, âgée de 36 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 9 mois à 17 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Amy à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Amy cultive l'arachide, le mil, le dah sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de matériels agricoles.Amy entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des engrais de qualité  et des semences de qualité . Cette année Amy effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 17 ans que Amy cultive l'arachide. Amy planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu d'acheter une charrue. Enfin Amy espère aussi pouvoir effectuer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Amy is shown in the photo sitting in the first row (second from left to right), dressed in red and yellow, holding a white handkerchief. She is a member of a group of 13 farmers registered at myAgro, who live and work in the village of Kirina to the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Amy is 36 years old and is a mother to eight children, ages 9 months to 17 years old, seven of which are currently in school. 

The roots of the family tradition in practicing agriculture, the main source of revenue and self-sufficiency for the home and feeding the family, incited Amy to work in this field for 20 years now. Amy grows peanuts, millet, and bissap on her plot of land, but must also cope with difficulties as a farmer, such as lack of quality fertilizer and growing materials. Amy is starting her first year with myAgro and registered on account of the quality fertilizer and seeds. 

This year, Amy is making payments to buy a packet of myAgro seeds (open pollination version) and fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase the yield of her land of .0625 hectares. Amy has been growing peanuts for 17 years. Amy plans to buy a plough with the increase of her yields and her revenue. Finally, Amy also hopes to be able to take care of daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy (OPV) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel, of Promised Land self-help group, is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Ezekiel commercialized his farming. He now earns income that provides for his family’s food and clothing and his children's school fees. Ezekiel is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to improve his banana farming. This will enable him to earn more income  to provide for his family's needs with ease. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to help boost farming, thus providing more income for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman and has three children going to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation.  With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Raphael's Group

texts.en:
This season is not the first one that Raphael is working alongside One Acre Fund. He has been a member for a few years now, having joined the program in 2010, and although he is the only person featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Raphael is often described by his community as a very reliable person, and decided to be the one to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. Like many of his fellow farmers, Raphael decided he wanted to be part of the One Acre Fund community in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

This loan will not only help Raphael, but the whole group, who will receive maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 37-year-old, hardworking married woman who has three children. Her son is also shown in the photo with her. For some years, she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her stitching skills. Sadia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years she has established a good clientele. 

Currently, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 49 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Catherine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family, and although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Catherine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Obtaining this loan means that Catherine's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 34-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is a driver by profession. He owns one jeep for providing transportation facilities in his locality, but now he needs some financial help. 

He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the jeep to provide better services. Therefore, Samina has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to help her husband to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the jeep to provide better services.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 28-year-old, married mother living with her husband and two children. She has been working since 2013 at her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme, and oil, etc. to help her family to improve their lifestyle and live in a proper way. 

Sahar is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise to give the best product to her clients. She states that she is very sure that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Regina, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is a mother to 7 children and is known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Regina joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Regina plans to buy a cow.

Between the 10 farmers in Regina's Group, a total of 4.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Naman's Group

texts.en:
Naman is a 46-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Naman has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Naman described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Naman’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & a solar light

loans.name: Julius's Group

texts.en:
Julius is 41 years old and has 5 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Julius has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Julius also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Julius's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & a solar light

loans.name: Kaba Thayu 2013 Women Group

texts.en:
Lucy, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Kaba Thayu women group. She is 28 years old and has three children. She is married and lives with her family. 

Lucy sells motorbike spare parts, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She is happy for Hand In Hand Eastern Africa’s savings, and  the enterprise training she received which equipped her with knowledge that enables her to manage her business efficiently.

Lucy is borrowing from Kiva to add stock to her motor bicycle spare parts shop, such as rims, tyres and batteries. This will enable her to improve the living standard of her family, such as giving the children quality education and healthy diet. She intends to use part of the profit in providing food to the family and pay school fees for her children.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is named Esther. She is 37 years old and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

Esther practices vegetable farming by growing cabbages and carrots and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy manure to increase production and hence produce more stock of carrots and cabbages which will enable her meet her customers demands.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: buy manure fertilizer

loans.name: Mark's Group

texts.en:
Mark is a 63-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mark has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Mark described his harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus) last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Mark’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & a solar light

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Del Sector Perez Group

texts.es:
María (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía con blusa amarilla en la mano) es una madre de familia de cuarenta años, está casada tiene una familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre doce y diecisiete años, viven en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
María para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica de su región desde hace quince años, con esta labor él ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
María es una mujer muy optimista y con objetivos de superación,  que ahora ha organizado a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar un prestamo que lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de tipo, seda, alemán, lustrina para elaborar las mejores blusas típicas.
El sueño más grande de María es ser reconocida a nivel nacional como tejedora para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María (the first on the right side of the paragraph, with a yellow blouse in her hands) is a 40-year old mother.  She is married and has a family of four children of ages between 12 and 16.  They live in a community in Chichicastenango.

In order to support her husband with household expenses, María has worked making the traditional clothing of her region for fifteen years.  With this work, she has helped her children get ahead.

María is a very optimistic woman with goals of getting ahead, who has now organized a group of people to request a loan together.  She will invest it in the purchase of different types of thread, such as silk, German embroidery thread, and embroidery floss, to produce the best traditional blouses.

María's biggest dream is to be recognized on a national level as a weaver, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy different types of thread, such as silk, German embroidery thread, and embroidery floss, to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 44 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Hellen has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  Although Hellen described her last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Hellen also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Hellen's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer & a solar light

loans.name: Prisca's Group

texts.en:
